text:
all time favourite. always new layers to discover, and a fantastic feeling upon completing a bottle. the best of unibroue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cork bottle: Pours a deep rustic dark red, with medium head. Aroma: Dates, plums, concord grapes and toffee. Taste: Dark fruit, ripe cherries and Belgian yeast. Awesome quad.

This is a really good beer that borders on being great. The yeast and dark fruit noted are super pleasant, but it just doesnt quite seal a five from me. Its almost there and its good, but its not quite there.
Dark brown pour. Aromas of raisin and plum same in the taste but with some yeast notes as well. Boozy finish. Two thumbs up

From Saveur Biere. In Grimbergen glass. Watching Los Soprano 6x04. Lighter and more drinkable than usual in the style. The dark fruits profile is there but lower than id like, although improves as it warms up

Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, & brown sugar; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably figs & cherries), raisons, caramel, and spice; Nicely balanced; Overall, a bit sweet - but good.

I was really looking forward to a great taste experience when I opened this bottle. Right from the start I realized that I was to be disappointed. The aroma was more solvent than anything else. Flavor had some dark malt roastiness but was overwhelmed by a stressed yeast phenolic that really thinned out the palate of this BSA. Ive had similar home brews with this fault. Unibroue, or rather Sapporo, needs to check their yeast bank or clean their equipment.
750 ml bottle. Pored dark brown, foamy tan head. Aroma was fruity, raisin, plum, bread, yeast. Taste was mild sweet, raisin, plum, alcohol apparent.

Pours a dark chestnut with a dark reddish tint. A khaki head dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is not overpowering but is yeasty with raisin, jam overtones - more sweet than yeast. Palate is lighter than I expected, with a very slight stickiness. Bubbles are small but not such to make it seem creamy. Taste is dough and yeast frosted with dark fruits - almost like a dark sticky bun if that makes any sense. There are hints of dark grains in the back ground but dark fruits are prominent, with a very very slight bitterness in the after-taste. Its all very well balanced - almost artificially so. Its kind of like someone was trying make the most middle of the fairway example of what a quadruple is, and once you understand this one, you can then venture into the others. I like this a lot, dont get me wrong this is a tremendous beer, but for whatever reason dont find it all that interesting.
Całkiem nudna Belgia, dużo kolendry, leciutkie owoce i karmel. Wodniste i nieco puste. Takie o.
Bottlesharing w Piwotece. W aromacie sporo ciemnych owoców i kolendry. Smak słodki, kolendra dominuje, trochę brakuje ciała.
Bottle pours dark brown with an off-white head. Ripe dark fruity sweetness, hints of spice and clove in aroma. Some roasted malts and brown sugary notes later on. Sweet fruityness and plums in taste.

Brune voilée, reflets cuivrés, douce, fruitée et légèrement acidulée, lalcool nest que très peu ressenti en bouche pour le style. Très agréable. Bouteille 34.1cl achetée à un stand de marché de Noël, Noisy-le-Grand, bue le 10/02/2017.

One of the very best Unibroues out there. Fruity aroma and a nice very dark brown appearance. Medium sweetness with no bitterness--with hints of plums and malt. Its sort of like if you mixed Fin du Monde with a strong ale-- a bit darker and a bit more substantial, but not heavy and still certainly a Belgian at heart.

Purchased a while back at Market Street and I have been waiting to imbibe with great anticipation. Trois Pistoles only emphasizes why Belgian styles are so great. The cork comes out with a pop and I get a pour into my Chimay glass of an alluring inky dark body with a persistent eggshell-white head. The nose is dark fruit and spices. The taste builds on the smell, I get ripe red plum, raisin, clove, a hint of coriander with a nice finishing touch of bitterness. Very involved. An adult appeal. This shoots up to be one of my all-time favorites.
Great long lasting dark Belgium style beer. Very long in the mouth with sweetish finish.

Unibroue, ah! Unibroue, merci de mavoir rendu alcoolique a un jeune âge! Sincèrement. Merci! Sinon, je serais devenu quun pauvre poivrot accro a la Budweiser jimagine. Et oui, je suis votre brasserie depuis ces tout débuts, dans les années 90, jai pu constater les bières qui on perdu de leur gabarit (fin du monde et maudite) mais voici lexception qui tient encore la route la tête haute: La trois-pistole. Premièrement, cette bière est brune et non noire, quelquun connait des bières de style belge foncièrement noire? La couleur approche du noir oui mais avec la lumière elle devient brune (un peu comme la Nuit dautomne de Frampton, chef doeuvre de bière brune extrêmement foncée). Dans tout les cas, la Trois-pistoles est une bière de maîtrise totale, son amertume est adoucit avec un sucre brun quasiment fumée, il y a du cacao, un peu de reglisse noir, un fond boisée et malté, de même que des épices du genre cumin, cannelle et une petite amertume de bon aloi. Seule chose que je lui reproche est un arrière goût collant de houblon ou malt que lon retrouve dans toute les bières dunibroue, jimagine quil sagit dune marque de commerce, mais même lexcellent Terrible avait ce défaut.

Bottle. Unclear dark brown in color with an off-white head. Ripe dark fruity sweetness, hints of spicyness and vinous notes in aroma. Soft mouthfeel. Some roasted malts and brown sugary notes later on. Sweet fruityness in taste, some vinous notes and overripe plums in taste. Creamy finish with some sweetness and hints of spices. Quite nice.
bread, cereal, coffee, just a little bit smoked,medium sweetness, medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 34cl. served in a trappist glass. Cloudy amber brown, small frothy beige head, diminishing quickly, fair lacing; aroma dark roasted malts, caramel, vanilla, fudge, yeast; at first thin taste, develops slowly, light heavy sweet and slightly bitter, malty, roasty, caramel, alcohol; malty sweet aftertaste, hint of chocolate, brown sugar, spicy notes; medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation; not bad but expected more, less complex and rich than hoped.
Weak Aroma. Tastes like its sister the noire de Chambly but with less water and a beer can taste.
Arôme faible. Mousse qui retombe trop vite. Brun Très fonce.pas bcp de gout mais pas floteuse. Biere sans cachet

Sweet malts, grain, caramel, light spices, alcohol. Very hazy, dark brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Heavy sweet. More sweet malts, grain and caramel, dark molasses, more spices, soft carbonation, full bodied, more complex malts, sugars. Beautiful Quadruple, complex, rich, well-balanced. Bottle from zBierhuus, Thun.
Dark with a tall head. Dried dark fruits, light spice, caramel and brown sugar, cherry. Full bodied. Full fruit and malt flavor profile. Very enjoyable brew.

Courtesy of VDuquerroux. Couleur brune ambrée, bonne mousse. Nez fruits noirs, malté doux, note de levures. Gout fruits noirs, malté avec un coté sucré et levures, bien dans le style belge. Des notes épicées et réglisse. Bon corps. Thanks a lot Vincent!!
Flaska på Thunder Bay Grille Pewaukee. Mörkt brun med massa ljusbrunt skum. Doft av bourbon och torkad frukt. Liknande smak.
Bottle into snifter. Pours a deep brien with an off white head. Aroma of cinnamon and dried fruits. Taste is dried fruit and cardboard. A bit musty too. Nothing special but not awful.

0,341l bottle at home from Saveur Biere. BB 28/02/2018. black color, small tan head. smells caramel, yeasty, spices, peach, decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of caramel, light honey, #spices, yeast, light alcohol, peach, bit musty, cardboard. finishes lightly sweet with notes of cardboard and honey notes. ok but not overly exciting.

355ml bottle. Aroma is cinnamon, cloves, cream, chocolate. Flavour is lots of dried fruit, some cinnamon, chocolate and cherry liqueur. Rich, spicy and no intention of hiding the strength. Quite nice.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 taki troche moj whale, bo wez to dostan w PL... ale skoro jest... mega mocno syknelo przy otwieraniu, ale gushingu nie ma (warka do 28-02-18, ale w sumie to nie mam pojecia, kiedy rozlana). brazowo-rubinowe z taka sobie piana. Aromaty intensywne i zaskakujace dosc, bo ewidnie przyprawowosc dominuje... jakies gozdzikowo-pieprzowo-kolendrowe (apage!) nuty... jest tez chleb, karmel, jakies blizej niesprecyzowane ciemne owoce. w ustach mala rewolucja, bo na moje szczescie przyprawowosc przestaje byc taka hej do przodu i chowa sie za reszta, a pojawia sie wiecej owocow (np przejrzale gruszki? ciekawe co to... ale oczywiscie figowo-rodzynkowe, moze nieco bananowe i wisniowe tez... takie mile misz masz), jakies slodkawo-zbozowe rzeczy... ciala srednio, alko ladnie ukryte, goryczki sladowo, posmaki bardzo dlugie i fajnie sie rozchodzace...sumarycznie to troszeczke zawod, w koncu piwo z top10 rb w swoim stylu nie powinno ddawac koledra, cnie? ale wlasciwie poza tym niuansem, to klasa :) drugie piwo juz znam ktore daje kolendra, a jest super (pierwsze to byl Chimay 150)Rami Rami is drinking a Trois Pistoles (2016) by Unibroue at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaPrzegieta kolendra, zaglusza fajna reszteocenka usrednieniem obu butelekOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma is dry, barrel, clove, spices, yeast, eh. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, hazy. Taste is dark fruit, yeast, dry, barrel, booze, spices, clove. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, dry woody aftertaste. Overall, its good I guess.

Nose features banana, cloves, caramel malt and dark berries. A frothy off white head on a dense mud brown body (I mean that in a good way). A well balanced taste profile features dates, cloves and cinnamon, caramel malt, dark berries, yeast and apples. Great balance, lively carbonation and solid medium body and texture.

Bottle pour. Dark brown with a large brown head. Aroma is raisin, dark fruits, roasted malts, and light alcohol. Full thick body. Very sweet with a bitter kick.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown medium white head. Strong malt aroma, fruity and plum (but not as much as a Rochefort 10). A bit sweet.
Bottled. Pours a flattish brown black with rapidly disappearing off beige head. Lots of dark fruit and malt. Raisin raspberry etc. Pretty well done.

Dark brown with beige head. Aroma of raisins and plumbs. Some alcohol. Taste is sweet dried fruit - plums, figs. Sweet residual finish. A slight warming alcohol but deceptive for 9 abv. Very nice especially as it warms up a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, dark brown with a 3-finger khaki head and good lacing. 

Aroma of raisins, other dark fruit, leather, wet leaves, molasses, chocolate and a depth of complexity I can't begin to fathom. 

Taste of ripe fruit, raisins, yeast, dark fruit, chocolate, banana, roasted malt and more wonders. 

Medium body and high/medium carbonation. 

An incredibly good beer. I've enjoyed this beer for years. It varied from bottle to bottle, it has always been wonderful. This bottle is the best in my memory. Perhaps it new that today was the day I would finally get around to rating it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy, opaque nut brown with a creamy, 1-finger tan head. Sweet aroma, maybe candied fruit, over notes of malt. Body is medium-to-full and slightly syrupy. Lightly astringent finish. Flavor of caramel and nutty malt, with a note of candied fruit. Mild bite of alcohol at the back.
Poured from a tap as part of a high ABV flight. Light brown and little lacing. A bit tinny for my tastes, bubbly but somewhat bland.

Bottle from Saveur Biere. Hazy very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark sugar, yeasty, ripe banana and dark fruit. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. 071016
Bottle.Black with a medium head. Malty and powerful with a strong mouth feel. Perhaps not as good as the Belgian originals of this style but still pretty impressive.

25.4 oz bottle. Khaki-colored, lingering head with dark brown to red color. Aromas of leather, wet fall leaves, dark dried fruit . A little woody, a little smoky, but crisp. Dark fruit, prunes, very ripe apples, and molasses without being heavy. Herbs and yeast. The slightest bitterness in the finish. Lots of flavors with nothing overpowering the others. Quite nice. Medium body with significant effervescence.

F: big, off-white, not long lasting.
C: dark to dark brown, red tones against the light, hazy, opaque.
A: malt, chocolate malt, chocolate, molasses, dark fruits, caramel, spicy, 
T: malt, dark fruits, dried fruits, chocolate, candy, brown sugar, cocoa, woody, spicy, dates, full body, hint of more than normal carbonation, very good balanced but not as good as Belgian original style, but still worth to try, 341ml bottle from Eat Brussels 2016 festival.

Opaque black color with strong glass clinging activity. Extra foamy and creamy light brown 4 finger head, lasting around 15 to 20 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of caramel, fresh floral spices, and molasses. Flavors of strong molasses, dark fruits like berries, ester fruits like apple, oak, yeast, floral and herbal spices. Earthy, woody, and vinous. Highly sugary with low sharpness.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Very strong and long finish, ending with a dry and coarse thick leathery tongue coat of bitter earthy yeast, some oak barrel feel, and a smoky burnt molassy and thick estery feel.

Overall excellent quality craft. Fully flavored and quite tasty. Highly acidic and boozy, making an excellent winter warmer and appetizer. Complex and well balanced flavors. Although not very accessible having a very strong finish.

Bottle, BB 28.02.18 (from saveur-biere). Pours dark brown with beige-brownish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, Belgian yeast, malt, fruits, spices, slight metallic notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter, dark fruits, plums, malt, some metallic notes, acidic notes. Finish is dry bitter and caramel sugar. Covers alcohol rather well. Overall: ok belgian strong ale, but with the current rb rating (99 and style also 99) I was expecting something a lot better... Doesnt even come close to the best Belgian Strong Ales or the best Quads.

Bière très sombre, presque noire. Un peu déçu par la forte lomniprésence des saveurs végétales. On est assez éloigné du style belge que la bière revendique. On est presque sur un style Allemand au blé. Néanmoins cest une bière agréable.

Probada en The Ginger Man, New York. Agosto 2017. De grifo. Cerveza negra estilo belga, canadiense. Muy buena. 8/10

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Look: hazy brown with unstable white head.

Aroma: fruits, prunes, sweet, with peppery notes. Actualy it is similare to their tripel.
Taste: moderate to strong sweetnes with fruits tartness.
Flavour: macerated prunes, resins, caramel.
Warming spicy and alcohol finish.

Pours a dark brown with an off-white head from a bottle. Nose is of sherry, a little sourness, like a plum past its prime or something. Bready. Flavor is a syrupy cherry coke, with a bit of alcohol burn. Good beer.

Aroma of fruits and malt with notes of caramel. Dark brown liquid with a fine white head. Medium-high sweetness and light-medium bitterness. The taste doesnt last that long for this ale. Average lively carbonation, medium-full body and creamy texture.

Apparence : Brun foncé, reflets rouges vifs, semi-opaque, beau col beige, petite dentelle. 

Nez : Caramel, alcool, légères épices (moins présentes que dautres Unibroue), léger boisé, fruits rouges et ses tannins de type raisins rouges, fruits séchés (pruneaux, dattes, figues).

Goût : Pain grillé, minéral (!?), sucrée, légère amertume. Bonne intensité. Ce nest quen faisant rouler que lon dénote les petits côtés fruités et boisés. 

S : Effervescence plutôt faible, corps moyen, légère chaleur dalcool, longueur moyenne-plus du côté malté.

Bref : Très, voire trop facile à boire. Le corps est tout de même décevant pour une Abt. Côté minéral surprenant et pas dans le bon sens. Où sont cachés les fruits que lon retrouve quand même au nez? Où est cette intensité réconfortante que lon retrouve dans dautres quadruples? Le travail de la levure aurait pu être supérieur. Pour moi, on nest pas dans la cours des grandes Quadrupels.

Bottle 33cl
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Seville, Spain.
A: Brown.
T: Malt, yeast, sweet, fruity.

Difficile à dire, elle est dautant bonne que sa légende! Dans sa noirceur se cache des arômes de café et de chocolat. Bien équilibré dans lensemble, 9% dalcool. Sait plaire aux amateurs de stout comme moi :)

Pours caramel brown with a big tan head. Nose is sharp fruit esters and belgian candy with a bit of booze and bread. Flavor is a rich Belgian smorgasbord of yeasts, dark fruit, sugars, and warm malts. Finish is sweet and sticky. Excellent beer.

Bottle, 341mL. Home. 12-14°C tasting. A dark brown opaque beer with a big off-white foamy head ; good retention. Roast, licorice, cinnamon, fruits (red berries, blackberry), light herb, alcohol, light coffee. Medium sweet, round, light dry, warming atmosphere. Full body, average texture, average carbonation, spicy lasting warming finish. Overall, a good strong belgian ale ; sweet, spicy, maybe too strong. I didnt drink this beer for 7-8 years now ! I was so happy to drink this one ; nevertheless, slightly disappointed by my memories.

750ml bottle. Pours an unclear, dark reddish brown with a medium, creamy, long lasting, beige head that laces. Sweet aroma of overripe fruit, cinnamon, roasted malt and yeast. Sweet flavour of dark fruit, roasted malt, cinnamon, vanilla and yeast with warming alcohol in a dry, almost wine-like finish. Medium to full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. A world class Trappist-style ale.

Reviewed March 22, 2014.

A: Pours a dark ruby color with some impressive carbonation. The head is two fingers high, and off-white in shade. Texture wise, it looks extremely fizzy (like soda) and has very poor retention. No lacing is left behind.

S: Wow, this is really spicy. While the yeast dominates, the subtle notes of chocolate and brown sugar help give it some depth. The more it warms up, the more I notice its impressive dark fruit notes, and the more I like it. Nitpick: the yeastiness could be toned down slightly.

T: It starts off very fruity - mostly dark fruits, but there are hints of cherries as well. Bready, spicy yeast builds up slightly in the middle before a caramel and chocolate finish. While a bit simple, its also very pleasant and easy to enjoy. Actually, I shouldnt call it simple: pour in the dregs, and this becomes a richer, more complex offering, varying some of the malt and ester notes beyond caramel and dark fruits, respectively.

M: Holy frig, this is drinkable and light. Not only that, its surprisingly clean, without a hint of the 9% coming through. The dry finish and healthy carbonation means one could be inclined to chug this - but why would you want to? With the dregs, the body becomes fuller, the cleanliness goes away, and the finish becomes a little sweeter.

O: A lot of people seem to dislike Unibroues yeast profile - Im not one of them. As always from Unibroue, the alcohol is concealed marvelously, without sacrificing anything in the way of richness or depth. Thank cripes this is very readily available, because Ill definitely drink this again.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Bottle at home. Cloudy, dark brown/amber colour, big foamy beige head. Typical Belgian dubbel tones: caramel malts, dried fruits, brown sugar. Nicely balanced. Bitter and malty aftertaste. Good body, low carbonation, velvety soft mouthfeel. Well done, but tastewise not too special.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Banana bread,alcohol, plum, raisin, Belgian sugar, and ester aromas. Taste is yeasty bread, esters, plum, raisins, caramel, Belgian sugar, cloves, black  pepper, other spices, and some alcohol.
Bottle. Pours a deep brown color with white head. Malty, yeasty, toffee aromas. Malty, syrupy, plum flavors. Solid, but not as good as the other main Unibroue beers.

Poured a thick 1/2" foamy light brown head. Has a dark brown almond colour. Nicely carbonated and ok lacing. Aromas of light malts and hints of vanilla. Flavours of strong roasted malts and mild chocolate like flavours as well. Somewhat bitter. Still goes down nicely, does not seem like a beer of 9% abv. Good stuff.

Aroma dark fruits, 
Appearance brown, cloudy, hazy, white foam, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, 
Overall Im getting an off flavor in the after taste. It almost tastes like dish water to me. Im not sure what it is but Im not liking it. I would not suggest this beer to a friend.

Medium/strong slightly pungent aroma with dark fruits like raisin and plum, some cherry notes. Dark amber color with medium light beige head and hazy liquid. Strong taste with dark slightly roasted fruits and malts, a hint of banana and some artificial rubbery notes. Averagely balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with dark fruits and malts. Medium body with strong carbonation. Overall, a bit lo fidelity feeling from really high carbonation and somewhat simple and artificial taste.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: caramel malt and brown sugar domination. Candied notes. Really sweet and fruity. Taste: full body with caramel malt and brown sugar. Really intensive body. Good attenuation and quiet drinkable. Total respect of the style. Aftertaste: alcohol and caramel.

Tasted from the 750 ML bottle with Marc. It was very dark with a tall head, almost like a Guiness. Roasted malt with a hint of cocoa and coffee flavors. Easier to draw no than the 9% alcohol would suggest. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from saveur-biere. Dark copper to brown. Medium brownish head. Light to medium sweetness and bitterness. Quite balanced taste. Aroma is roasted, fruity, malty, woody, resin. Pretty tasty!

Pours a dark reddish brown with a thick dense beige head that leaves lacing and a smaller fll head. The nose is ripe fruit s it says. The body is medium. Taste is sweet dried fruit, , coffee, dark malt. 112 oz bottle in a variety pack BBY: 6/22/17

Taken from a sampler pack. Cellared 1 year.

Another great beer by another great Canadian Brewery

Smells like a Belgian Tripel/Quad. Very sweet, with alcohol undertones.

Pours a dark brown/red colour. Head at beginning similar to Guinness, but it almost dissapears by the end.

Taste is very sweet almost sugary. No booze flavour.

Good amount of carbonation. Little aftertaste, especially for a 9% beer.

 Overall I was very happy with this beer. I will be purchasing as a gift pack, but not on a 6 pack of its own.

MB
The Beer Bearon

Originally rated on 8/4/08. It poured a dark brown body, with a light tan cap. The aroma was really nice, a mixture of cherries, apples, banana, and plum, all ripe like the bottle says. The fruit carries over into the taste, where there is also malt, yeast and a sublte sweetness that blend very well together. Even with the high alc. content it is very smooth, with a creamy mouthfeel. A beer worth seeking out for sure.

Cola coloured pour with a thick, puffy beige head. As it settles down, there is a big, yeast aroma, dried fruit, sweet malt. The taste is plummy, jammy, raisins, caramel, a little spice. As it warms up the dried fruit is more apparent, as is the booze.

Murky brown color with beige head. Aroma has dark fruits, dark sugar and some booze. Taste has some nice dark cherries and raisins, dark sugar and a bit of alcohol. Medium body with high effervescence. Nice but not one of my favorite styles of beer.

Bouteille. Nez de prunes intense, de caramel doux, de levures, dalcool et léger de malt. Goût de prunes (mûres, cerises?) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi rapidement par un goût de caramel toffee sucré et un léger goût dherbes et par la suite dun goût sucré de caramel malté et de levures et un goût dalcool est présent tout le long. Arrière-goût légèrement amer dalcool et légèrement sucré de caramel. [notes 2005]

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 Bottle into a balloon glass. Very dark brown brew, opaque and smelling of dark sugar and yeast. Highly carbonated and at 9%, barely a hint of alcohol noted. Medium bodied, yeasty with a mild flavor of dark fruit, lots of maltiness, this is a pleasant, but somewhat understated brew. I let the bottle sit at room temperature for an hour or so to bring up more flavor, and certainly the warmer it gets, the more complex it is. The spiciness comes out, as does the alcohol, fruits and malt after another hour or so of sitting. As the website suggests, a temperature near 60f maximizes the taste profile, and my appreciation. Lets settle for subtle flavors when chilled. The Unibrow website offers a lot of information about this brew, but nothing on the hops used. At 15 IBU, obviously they were an afterthought. A fine brew hidden for a while by excessive refrigeration and effervescence.

Mostanra már világossá vált, hogy a kanadai főzetek, különösen az Unibroue sörei a kifinomult elegancia képviselői, harsány és közönséges, robbanásszerűen ható karakterre felesleges is számítani az esetükben, különösen, ha a quadrupelek egy mintapéldányáról beszélünk. Bár azt, hogy a kategória jelenlegi 6. legjobb söreként tekintsünk rá talán túlzásnak érzem, összességében mégis egy kifogástalan belga hangulatú főzet tárul elénk a felnyitását követő percekben. Vörösesbarna színe puha és krémes habbal osztozik, illatai teltek, édeses malátásak, élesztősen sokszínűek. A kortyok gömbölyűek, simák és tartalmasak, gabonás alapoktól vezéreltek. Az ízvilág homogén jegyek halmaza, kiugrásoktól mentes, melyben minden egyes elem a helyén van - egyenes nyomvonalú, szigorú hangulatú szerkezet ad otthont a mérnöki módon megszerkesztett komponenseknek. Kenyérhéjas, kelt tésztás keretbe burkolva sejlenek fel a száraznak ható, visszafogott intenzitással bíró aszalványos, mazsolás színezetű elemek, majd állnak össze egy krémes állagú, bársonyos jellegű, simulékony és jól ismert mondanivalót hordozó karakterré a mérsékelt vérmérsékletű ízjegyek.

A very dark brown beer, a head is big, clouding and beige. Aroma has riped fruits, raisins, prunes, flowers and some lime. Aromatic flowerness is refreshning the aroma. Taste has riped fruits, prunes, flowers and some lime. Medium bodied, strong carbonation, but softly. Strong flavours are fresh and there are not any heavy nuancess. Also great aromatic notes. The great beer. Slightly similar than the other great beer, Abbaye des Rocs Triple Impériale.
Smell and taste is malt and mineral. Medium body, medium carbonation, and pretty foamy.
Taste a bit of spice. Coriander? Possibility? It has a bit of fruit as well. Of Course it is a full bodied beer. It is a beer to enjoy with friends who like to live.
Rated from old notes. Very dark, sweet, with plenty of (yeast?) floating in a cloudy brown-red beer. Smells like orange pop, but the taste is spicy and complex. Very warming. Excellent.
Tap at Beer Authority, New York. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, dry fruits, ripe fruits, Belgian yeast and malts.

From a 355ml bottle on 1/2/2016. Pours a deep mahogany with a medium head. The nose features chocolate, dark fruit and a bit of spice. Taste wise, its bold and complex, beginning with chocolate and caramel malt, followed by plums, dates and peach, with some mild spiciness at the back. The palate is quite creamy and the carbonation light and a little fizzy. A really cohesive, approachable and enjoyable dessert beer. Definitely amongst the best quads Ive had.
Highly carbonated which I feel doesnt suit the taste of the beer. Pours a rich coffee like dark brown. Strong spiced aroma and Taste. Fresh spice hits with a bit of nutmeg.

Bottle at Martins West in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is dark breads, dark fruity malts. Taste is a bit underwhelming and slightly bitter. Was hoping for something else...more of a bitter pill than expected.
Prevalent aroma. Deep coffee brown color. Persistent, light tan, small-bubble head. Higher carbonation than I would expect. Lighter bodied. Not my favorite.

Lets get aroma out of the way. This definitely has an aroma, but for some reason, I cannot place what exactly I am smelling. (update: after it sat for a while, got more of a dark fruit smell and a yeast smell). Pours a very dark brown with a dense, tan head. Beautiful looking beer. Taste of dark fruits and yeast.

It just feels very over-carbonated to me. Even after it sat for a while, it was very lively on the tongue. Too much for my preference. Also, a bit more medium bodied than expected for a Quad.

330ml bottle, BB 18 Dec 17. Pours dark ruby red in my Struise tulip glass, with nice fluffy and long lasting tan head. Interesting aromas of earthy yeast, stewed plums, raisins, some red wine. Less heavy and flavoursome than expected - plums, light red wine tannins, the earthy yeastiness. Lightly dry in the finish. Very light bodied, drinks more like 4.5% than 9% ABV. Not bad at all but I?d hoped for more flavour in a beer like this.

12 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a reddish tint and a creamy light-beige head. Aromas of dark fruits, yeast, malt and alcohol. Taste: dark fruits, some spice, red wine. There is a fairly strong yeast presence. Fairly sweet finish with very little bitterness.

0.341 bottle. Hazy, dark brown color and virtually no head. Aroma of malts, spices, overripe fruits, and a bit of alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty, delicately alcoholic again. A medium body, a slick texture, and a lively carbonation. Finish is bitterer, a bit off balance. Overall a standard beer, I have no idea what the hype is about. Perhaps a wrong bottle.

Aroma: fragrant from a foot away; sweet and malty; a little bready; Appearance: very dark with a flat head; Taste: sweet, malty but also wheaty/yeasty; some fruity notes; Palate: medium body, soft carbonation; long, sweet finish; Overall: can appreciate the quality but dont care for the yeastiness

Bière de couleur brune assez foncé avec le peu de reflets qu'il y'a couleur rouge caramel
La mousse qui est fine et compact laisse une belle dentelle
Au nez on va sentir des arômes caramélisé et fruité comme les figues les datte le pruneau
En bouche on va sentir des saveurs sucrées et alcoolique
Avec toujours des saveurs de pruneaux de datte 
On va ressentir une légère amertume et enfin de bouche un retour alcoolique puissant
Bottle from Bignens Vins. Poured a deep brown colour, high carbonation and thick white foam. Sweet and fruity. Spicy hop. A touch boozy. Light yeasty esters. A solid strong beer.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Another looker from Unibroue - hazy deep brown with perfect lasting, clingy beige head. Aromas of yeast, candi sugar and tart fruit. Flavor is similar with some sweetness of malt and caramel balancing with a somewhat tart bitter.

Aroma: caramel, dark fruits, Belgian yeast, nuts
Appearance: hazy brown with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, dark fruits, cherries
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Tres formidable!

Flaska på Beer-ditch. 2004 vintage, drucken rumsvarm. Djup mörk bärnstensfärg med krämigt skum. Stor riktigt fin doft av madeira, portvin, torkade dadlar, fikon och päron. Snudd på en 10:a. Smaken avslöjar tyvärr att konditionen inte riktigt är på topp, ganska platt munkänsla utan kraft och värme, torkad frukt och madeira men mer platt och sirapssött och en del lakrits eftersmaken dör ut ganska snabb och lämnar en eftersmak av lakritsal. Har druckit den färsk för löänge sedan och det var roligt att prova en gammal.

Flaska på Beer Ditch Malmö. 11-årig flaska, smak och doft av mörk sirap, mörk torkad frukt, plommon toner av karamell och lakrisalpastill. Fin doft av Madeira men smaken hänger inte med, platt, sötsliskig, ändå kolsyra kvar efter alla år. Svårbedömd!

I cant help but be impressed when a brewer takes a naturally big and rich style of beer and makes it keenly approachable. Dark Belgian beers arent always easy-drinking brews, but Trois Pistoles offers some highly palatable darkness. Trois Pistoles pours brown with a sexy tan head. Aroma has dark fruits, caramelized sugar, toasted malt, and booze. Flavors redolent of molasses, plum, prune, raisin, grape, and a hint of chocolate. Yes, its similar to a Port. This is a dessert beer thats actually mellow enough it can be enjoyed with actual dessert. And not so heavy you cant chase it with another beer. Or maybe thats just me... What? Who says you cant have more than one Unibroue in a night?

Bottle shared pours a dark cola color with a quick dissipating head. Sweet malty aroma, dark fruits, alcohol, and s Belgian yeast strain. The flavor is strong and more of the same. Very good flavor of sweet malts and dark fruits blended with a nice alcohol burn.

Best by 04-23-18. Pours a dark generally murky brown with a huge head. Aroma is (first) clove, banana, bubblegum (big ester tripel notes). Then after you get really classic quad aroma - dark ripe fruits, plums, fig, dates, roasted malt note. Flavor is sweet ripe dark fruits, again, plum, fig-heavy, spice notes prevalent. Solid quad. Ive had this in the past and I remember it being better. Its very good but it doesnt stand out to me as being any better than any other really solid quad.

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Brune foncée aux reflets de rubis avec très peu de mousse blanchâtre sur cette bière pourtant effervescente. Nez de malt fruité (dattes/figues?) et sucré sur un fond dalcool boisé. Moyenne de corps, elle passe quand-même assez vite en bouche. Première sensation fruitée/sucrée suivie dune légère amertume qui attaque le palais et le fond de gorge. Lalcool nest ressenti quen rétro olfaction, mais réchauffe bien les tripes après quelques lampées.

Embouteillée le 20/08/2015, bue après 2 mois. Robe brune foncée aux reflets acajou. Beau col de mousse blanc épais et onctueux. Dentelle mielleuse et collante. Arômes de baies confites, pruneaux, dattes, chocolat, levures, malt caramelisé. Belle complexité, légèrement épicé. En bouche, de belles saveurs fruitées prennent dassaut le palais. Mûre, pruneaux, figues et dattes. Suivent les levures, épices et le cacao. Le houblon perce en finale par son goût plus amer. Texture plus légère que le laisse présager le style. Corps rond et bonne complexité. Mélange de saveurs et équilibre sans fautes. Un classique.
Cloudy brownish tan, tan head. Raisins, dark mellow fruit, light spice. Lightly bitter, sweeter. Heavier body, some decent alcoholic bite. Longer finish, chewy, some oiliness. Good.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a reddish brown with small tan head. The aroma is full of fruit, spices and cocoa. The flavor is the real triumph here, a sweet fruit blend that hides the high ABV. Overall, a world class beer Unibroue has done it again.
Sweet malty smell...quite good but hard to place, taste is like butterscotch but with bitterness to counter...a couple dimensions... Bittersweet...smooth
caramel, vanilla, red, brown, hazy, white foam, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation,

Bottle.

A- Brown sugar, dark fruits, grapes, slightly boozy.

A- Dark mahogany color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Brown sugar, grapes, raisins, candied fruits, alcohol.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, dry finish.

O- This was indeed more of a wine feel than what I am used to in a Quad. Felt a little odd on the mouth feel and not the complexity it should have. A little let down here.

341 ml bottle. Bought in La mise en Biere in Lausanne. Fantastic dark fruit smell, but not in the trappist kind of way, a little more sweet than that, also you can feel pepper, dark chocolate. Good looking dark color with a white head, nice fermentation. Taste is outstanding, fantastic! Just fills your mouth and doesnt let anything out, fantasticly balanced. Give me this beer for the rest of my life and ill archive nirvana. One of the best I have ever tried, great job, Unibroue!

The scent is most marked by fruit, but also a little caramel malt can be traced. Furthermore, it smells a bit spicy. The taste is quite something. The dominating from the start with a powerful sweetness full caramel malt, which slowly turns into a very complex fruity taste where I can feel slightly tart apple, sweet plum and maybe peach. The finish contains a nice spicy finish of coriander and chocolate and everything is incredibly well in harmony together.

Bottle from Drinks of the World, Geneva. Pours mid to dark brown. Intense candy sugar and yeast aroma. Sweet taste with a naked alcohol burn: tastes as strong as it is! Nicely carbonated body. This is an intense beer and while it isnt quite as balanced as many of the classic Trappist quads, its still a fairly special beer.

Pours deep ruby; almost black. Nice, frothy off-white head. Aroma is plum, bittersweet chocolate, slightly peppery, maybe molasses. Taste is white pepper, plum, raisin, some notes of chocolate and just a little booze. Tastes almost like a dark saison, very similar to Three-Eyed Raven. Overall very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A Unibroue quad through and through, with a nice fruitiness and a hint of nuttiness but that overlively carbonation.

Pours a medium dark purplish brown. There is some dark fruit and spice in the aroma. Most of the flavor hits the front of the tongue then quickly disappears. There is enough flavor to hide the alcohol but it doesnt linger and you really cant savor it because its gone to fast. Not too bad but not much to talk about.

Tap; pours dark brown with a beige head; aroma of dark fruits, yeast, caramel, and a hint of malt; taste is sweet with caramel, dark fruits, and yeast with some malt notes; finishes dry with a light bitterness; very nice
One Bad Ass beer! Dark, foamy, light sweet aroma, and packed full of flavor. This is the beer that changed it all for me.

Jai pris du temps à savoir lapprécier, et cest aujourdhui que jai compris. Peut-être quil fallait des années pour enlever de ma mémoire les beuveries à même la bouteille (aucun respect!) pendant mes études dexamen universitaire. Des bons souvenirs, mais pas pour la dégustation de bière! Aussi, cest une quadrupel quon doit boire lété! Aujourdhui il fait chaud, et elle désaltère à souhait. Pourtant, elle est brunes foncés. À son nez, on sent déjà un pétillement frais au travers des arômes de raisins (popsicle mauve :)) et de fruits mûres. En bouches, cest étonnement léger, les résidus sucrés/fruités sévaporent dans les bulles avant une finales quon savoure pendant de longues secondes. Tout ça pour seulement 6$/750ml, à porter de main dans tous les dépanneurs du Québec, on ne connait pas notre chance!

bottle. Pours an extremely dark black with a large beige head and very lively carbonation. Aroma is of spices, plums, and raisins. Flavor is fruity with spices in the finish. Full bodied with creamy texture. Very good.

Bottle from Harvest Market, Bedford NH. Aroma is wild mix of bready malt, a musty yeastiness kind of like a pencil eraser, spices, alcohol and fruit esters. Appearance is virtually opaque dark brown at center of glass with hazy, lighter brown (light dark cider) at the outside, with nice effervescence and persistent foamy beige head with mild lacing that doesnt linger on the glass. Taste is moderate sweetness and light sour. Palate is moderate to heavy bodied with thick texture, lively carbonation (perhaps a tad too much) and a nice, pleasant sweet over sour finish. Overall, this is really nice and interesting, hitting pretty fully on all levels. Aroma is a bit more interesting than taste and mild demerits for too much carbonation, but those are the nitpicking separating this from perfection.

750 mL bottle. Pours a deep, burnt sienna, massive beige head with ridiculous retention and nice lacing. Nose is Belgian yeast funk, candy sugar, allspice, banana, dried fruit, plums. Mouth is medium bodied, drier than I anticipated, caramel, fruit, bubblegum, spice, toasted bread, well balanced and the ABV is only evident at the back of the throat. Very nice Quad.

Bottle into a tulip. Pours an inky black, with a small tan head that fades into a disk on the surface. Nose is dark fruit and dark roast malt. Taste is dark fruit with a hint of Belgian yeast banana and clove. Delicious. An outstanding brew from one of North Americas best breweries.
Bottle. Pours ruby brown with big off white head. Lots of carbonation. Nose is lots dark fruit. Taste is Belgian sweetness and dark fruit. Dry wine in the aftertaste.

Bottle @ Stout, Toronto. Pours hazy dark ruby with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel, sugar and fruit. Booze in the long nose. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt, with fruity and estery touches and mild notes of hops. Rough, estery aftertaste with mild acidic hints. Potent and heavy but well-balanced and enjoyable

As a side bar, I cant believe I have never rated this beer before. Its been an old standby for a long time.

It pours deep hazy violet with ruby highlights; the head is off-white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: dark bread, rum-soaked raisins, fruitcake, and dark fruits. The taste is medium sweet that finishes lightly bitter; there are notes of: dark fruits, dark bread, prunes, and rice rice pudding. The palate is medium-heavy bodied, has light carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, a very consistent and well crafted beer - almost makes me patriotic

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a fairly decent and lasting beige head. Nice aroma of malt, some caramel with dried fruits, though some alcohol can be noted. Sweet start, a feel of caramel and mild bitterness. Alcohol presence can be picked up, though not too excessive. A decent one.

Pours a very dark brown hue with a very thick and frothy head and light carbonation. Has a fruity aroma and a stout and strong but great taste, leave a bit of a dry aftertaste. Its a good beer, a bit expensive but very delicious. I recommend this beer to anyone. Im not a fan on stout and thick beers but this is a good one.
Clear dark red with a nice to tiny light brown head. Dark ripe fruit, molasses, lightly burnt caramel, spice. Sweet. Medium body, slick with a soft carbonation, great long finish.

Aroma of smoked malt, and grains, pours a dark brown color with a moderately lasting tan well laced head. Moderate carbonation with a thick full bodied feel, tastes of ginger, prunes, smoked malt and grain. Short lasting smoky finish.

750mL bottle, poured into a snifter. The aroma is initially roasted grains and spice with a pungent prune, some tobacco, and some funk. It pours a murky prune color with a light, fuzzy tan head thats wispy with only light retention and no lace. The taste is a medium high bitter and medium sweet. The texture is a moderate thick and oily one with only a light fuzz for carbonation, and a medium full body thats flavored with bread, spice, tobacco, and plums. It finishes spicy with a zip and has warm flavors of prunes and spice and leaves an aftertaste thats bready and lingering with a light spice, alcohol, and fig.

Pours a dark cloudy brown with a large beige head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, yeast with some dark fruity notes. Taste is sweet dark malts, dark plum fruit notes, yeast, some mild tartness. Palate is a medium body, fairly smooth with good carbonation. Finishes with a dark malt and dark fruit flavor of plums, maybe some raisin notes, yeast and a slightly dry sweet alcohol ending. Overall a good smooth and full flavored brew.
Smell and taste of date, caramel, anise. Sweet and thin sour. Very thin white cloud, light body, slightly thin texture but good amount of alcohol. Good but too sweet and much spice for me

On-tap at the Yard House in PBG, FL. Served in a goblet.

Dark red, nearly black with no head by the time it got to my table. No lacing. Doesnt look like it has much carbonation.

Delicious smell. Figs and dark fruit. Some caramel malts and the typical candi sugar smell.

The taste isnt quite as impressive as the aroma. Some aromas translated into flavor: the figs and other fruits and the belgian candi sugar. A bit of licorice in the finish.

Very light bodied for such a strong beer. Low carbonation and a very dry finish.

 Finished the glass easily without feeling as though I had drank a 9% alcohol beer. Remarkably well made beer.

Bottle at tasting, thanks for sharing all the beers!
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: fruity, oak, malty.
TASTE: fruity, oak, malty

Bottle 341ml @ Hotel room, Webers, Ann Arbor, MI
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, brown sugar and hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, dried fruits and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Ottima strong ale, si presenta marrone scuro con riflessi rossi e schiuma beige chiaro. Aroma di dark fruits. Eccellente la bevuta con una dolcezza ben equilibrata, malto in evidenza e una perfetta carbonazione.

Color is dark cloudy brown with some heavy lacing. It has aromas of dried fruit, sourness, yeast, spices and alcohol. It has strong carbonation, sour flavor with spices and salt. It has alcohol warming.

Aromas of plum and caramel. Some bread and alcohol.

Dark brown, perhaps slightly cloudy (hard to tell whe. Its dark). Slight off-white head.

Taste is pretty sweet, but in a good, fruity way. Not much bitterness.

Medium body. Creamy, slick and a tad oily texture. Carbonation just a little on the lively side (which I think works very well with this beer). Finish long finish with plum, bread and the carbonation.

Overall I like this beer a lot. Usually I need more of a hop balance to really like a beer, but this one works very well without it. I love the plum flavors and bread; the carbonation provides some balance. Even has a touch of raison, especially as it warms up.
Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, dark fruits and caramel. Tastes of roasted malt, spices, fruits & yeast. Well balanced. Good carbonation. Good drinkability.

12 oz pour from room-temperature bottle into tulip glass. Black and nearly completely opaque. Large fizzy white head with fairly quick spatulation. Medium body; maybe a little thin for my taste. Nose is sweet. Dark fruit, cherry, dark malt, raisin, maybe plum. Really nice. Taste is also fairly sweet and fruity. Cherry. Port or sweet, dark red wine notes. Lingering bitterness. Moderate alcohol burn undertone. Complex sipping beer.

Pours a murky red brown ruby color. Small tan head that doesnt hang around. Aroma of ripe plums and maybe slight fig. Caramel and almost roasty notes as well. The taste is similar to the nose, more depth in the malts though, some toffee almost coming through. Some more traditional belgian notes jab in such as bubblegum and pepper although only slightly and they fade quickly. Medium body with a relatively dry finish that hints at chocolate but doesnt go quite that far. Incredibly drinkable. Not the most complex quad ever, but certainly a tasty one. Thanks Cards04!

Rich dark fruit aroma. Deep mahogany red body with a off-white head, The head is exuberant at first and settles to thin covering after a short time. Heavy dark fruitiness and spice. Feels rich even with the lively carbonation. Warms the palate on the way down. Has a crisp finish that is on the dry side at the end.
Old rating. Dark brown pour, big malt body with plenty of fruit and spices. Very sweet, port-like as the description says. Nice after dinner stuff

Bottle: Dark reddish brown with an off white head. Dark fruit, cocoa, and spice aroma is followed by a fruity taste (stone fruit - apricot and plum - and raisins) and spices. Fairly balance with a slightly bitter finish.
12oz bottle. Deep brown color with one finger head. Aroma of dark fruit. Smooth and dark fruit taste, really a nice beer.
A very good Belgian styled beer. Heavy in alcohol without that aggressive burn. Dark yet some spice and fruit flavours, not just all malt. Very nice!
Deep brown pour, creamy off white head. Nose is herbs, coco, wood, and hint of cherries. Bittersweet. Middle is malt, smoke currants. Finish is smoky and sweet.
Really good. Big bold flavours of yeast, raisins, plumbs, figs, burnt caramel and toffee, brown sugar, and malts.
Malty with a little sweetness. Not highly carbonates but still fizzy. Just OK, nothing I think Ill buy again..

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Quality offering frpm Unibroue.Bread, spice. Brown Sugar. Yeast. Wine.Big sticky. 

A thick meal.

Pours murky, muddy brown. Raisins, and plum dominate the aromas. Palate is thick and slightly sticky. Tastes are the aforementioned raisins and plums, but some up front mint is on the tongue too. Maybe a bit of sweet molasses on the swallow.
A good solid craft brew, but the hyperbole swirling around this one, exceeded the actual experience of drinking it.

3/22/15 (Bottle) - Excellent dark pour with a nice white tan pillow head. Several fruits including raisins, cinnamon as well as caramel and others. Very pleasant taste, light texture and mild carbonation, but heavy kick and ABV - you feel it after drinking.

From a 12 ounce bottle into a Trappist glass. Pours a deep brown with a tad of head. Barely illuminates when held to a lamp. Nutty, fruity nose. Taste is some kind of tree fruit that fades well. Not too sweet. Not too shabby either. Note: this is compared to port, which is nauseatingly sweet for me. This beer is nowhere near the ports I have tried, only in minuscule flavor maybe. Dont let the comparison be off-putting please.

Bottle from Drinks of the World, Geneva. Pours deep brown with a cream head. Sweet aroma of raisin, port and caramel. The taste is rich and fruity with similar flavours, port especially. Spiciness to it as well. Tasty stuff.

12 oz. bottle from Utah State Liquor Store in Provo. Appearance: 2 fingers tan head that does not last too long, ok lacing, prune red color, cloudy. Aroma: fruity, citrus, coriander, light molasses in the background. Palate: medium body, average carbonation, oily texture, alcohol warming down the throat. Taste: sweet molasses that is quickly overtaken by lees and fruity sweetness, prune on the back end of the sweetness, turning into a light alcoholic finish. Overall, very smooth, pretty drinkable for size.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, ripe dark fruit, dates, little chocolate. Flavor is light sweet, rich malty, caramel, dark chocolate, ripe fruits, dates, raisins, some alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with some warming alcohol. 290810

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Pours beautiful dark garnet with substantial tan head that reduces quickly but lingers in decorative skim.
Aroma is dates, figs, black grapes, raisins, sweet malt. On the palate, caramel notes also emerge along with a wisp of chocolate, especially as it warms. Yes, this beer is better when given a bit of time in the glass. 
Very nice medium body and pronounced effervescence help make the mouthfeel satisfying without being heavy. Similarly, the alcohol is present, but as a warm note not a burn.
Its self-defeating for a brewer to compare a beer to port, especially old port, but I can sympathize with the impulse here. They arent the same, and yet theyre reaching for the same thing: a rich yet restrained beverage for a cold afternoon, a fine meal or just dessert,
Its a pleasure to drink a big beer that is light on its feet, whose makers are happy to present it as mellow rather than "wrecking." A rebuke to American craft beer.
Bottle pours dark maroon with thin tan head. Looks and smells like cherry coke. Taste of port with spice and malt. Nice even balance with quick finish.

From a 12 oz bottle with best by date 12/03/16. Quite dusty, not sure how old this one is. Enjoyed Thanksgiving night. Pours a dark maroon/purple, ruby highlights on the periphery with a nice collar. Looks like a highly carbonated cola to be honest. Smells sweet. Fruity smells from the yeast, dates. Taste follows the nose. Slightly metallic, dont know if thats from the age. But dark fruit all over. I have to say, for a beer this dark, I was expecting something much heavier, but this thing was so light in the mouth, maybe from the carbonation, maybe just the style. Not bad, but not quite next level.
Pours black with a light beige head. Aromas of malt and pepper. Similar flavor.
Bottle. Pours dark opaque brown with large head. Aroma of caramel, peper and candied fruit. Taste of grapes, caramel and light peper. Dry finish.

Aromas of purple grapes, cherry cola, subtle peppercorn, some caramel, cooked sugar. Hazy deep dark red, off-white head retains very well. Fruity, nice herbaceous spicy notes. Medium bodied, fluffy carbonation. A dangerously drinkable beer.

ENG: 750ml bottle from Liquor Mart Winnipeg. Poured into the tulip gives a very dark brown, iridescent color with orange highlights. Dark beige, medium head and a bit of lacing. Aromas of wheat, bananas, citrus, lemon grass, champagne and hints of yeast somewhere at the end. Taste is very sweet, banana-like, sweet champagne-like with its booze, and a bit sour. There is strong yeast presence. After some time I can feel caramel notes too (probably I cooled the beer down too much and didnt wait long enough after taking it out the fridge). Medium to high carbonation and medium bodied. Overall very nice, sweet wheat, although I am not a big fan of a style.
PL: Butelka 750ml kupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg. Przelana do kieliszka, ciemno-brązowa, opalizująca barwa z pomarańczowymi przebłyskami. Ciemno-beżowa, średnia piana i nieco lejsingu. Aromaty pszenicy, bananów, cytrusów, trawy cytrynowej, szampana oraz nuty drożdżowe gdzieś w tle. W smaku dość słodkie, trochę jak banany, trochę jak słodki lub półsłodki szampan, także nieco szampańskiego booza, a także nieco kwasowości. Mocno daje się odczuć drożdże, a po pewnym czasie również nuty karmelowe (prawdopodobnie za mocno je schłodziłem, a po wyjęciu z lodówki nie odczekałem wystarczająco). Średnie do wysokiego nasycenie oraz średnie ciało. Podsumowując bardzo dobra, słodka pszenica, pomimo że nie jestem jej zagorzałym fanem.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

For a big beer, its rather discreet, not hinting initially at its elevated ABV or heaps of fruit esters. Dark, sweet, dried fruit come through in the aroma. Dark, cola brown with active foamy head, which quickly dissipates. Taste brings more fruitiness, some wood, some molasses, all which finishes quickly with only a hint of warmth.

27 month old bottle from TBS. Pours a deep and murky reddish brown. Nose if full of fruity esters, plum, citrus, pineapple, grapes, apples. Taste follows the nose, lots of complex mingling fruits. Sweet and wine like. Lingering fruity finish. Slightly warming. Fantastic stuff.

I love port. I love heavy abv beers for the same reason - for ruminative sipping late of an evening and this fits the brief. This beer was mahogany in colour with plenty of hazy but also a mousse-like head that left patchy lace down the side of the glass. A nose of dates and overripe plums, some carob (I hate carob) and brown bread in a body that was silky and sweet with just a subtle bitterness that only really comes forward as it sits on the palate for a while. Speaking of which, this finish is enduring and becomes more chocolately as it sits.

Only way this rates higher then westmalle is lower expectation, given its not a true belgian. (In my opinion) overly carbonated from bottle pour and no, bottles were not poured at room temp, have about a second before getting it into glass. Only time Ive had issues like that were in cases where Brett was being used as well. Suspect more sucrose then belgian candij syrup as to the dry finish and lack of head, along with more cocao then dark fruit.bit of spice and bread flavor but lacks in mouthfeel.too light, too dry.
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Pours dark brown. Fruity notes. Belgian ale flavors with very subtle sweet fruit aftertaste. Great!

Pours clear amber-brown with two fingers of light tan head, excellent retention, spotty lacing. (4/5) Nose is dark vinous fruit, brown sugar, some Belgian yeast. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild bitter. (9/10) Full body, moderate carbonation, off dry and mildly boozy finish. (4/5)

Nicely integrated and mellowed but a couple years cellaring. (Should pick up a couple more of these and put them down for longer, to see how theyll change.) A very well-behaved and nicely-balanced strong dark. Nice beer for a cold winters afternoon, having just cleared the snow from the driveway! (16/20)

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a big but quickly dissipating creamy beige head that leaves little lace. Aroma of alcohol, leather, yeast and sweet red wine. Flavors of clove, coriander, dark red grapes, yeast. Light body, lightly bitter, bitter to sour finish, average carbo.

750ml cork bottle poured into a duvel glass around 12 degrees. Poured a deep mohagany, almost black robe, showing a faint ruby hue and good carbonation. You get about a finger and a half of lacy tanned head that fades pretty fast to an uneven porous layer. The nose is complex with bananas, raisins, plums, cherries, nuts, dark bread and alcohol. The taste is representative of what you get in the nose, paired with a good density and wonderful finish. You can put this beer in your cellar up to 8 years to let it evolve into an even more fruity and nutty ale. Cheers!

Aroma: Smells like commercially made bread in the US (think Wonderbread). Is this a Belgian thing?
Appearance: Deep, dark amber, almost black colored beer. More carbonation than expected. Lacy, two finger head that disappeared quickly. 
Taste: Raspberry, honey, brown sugar, raisins, cherries, fruit, and yeast. A bit of alcohol, Metalic front end and finish. 
Palate: Metalic front end that dissipates immediately into a surprisingly clean, airy, light, crisp, and carbonated feel in your mouth. 
Overall: I poured this 12 oz. bottle into a glass I like to drink beer in. I am not a Belgian beer fan but grabbed this and Chimay Blue from one of my local craft beer spots. This beer reminded me very much of the Chimay, but its weaker cousin. RateBeer member dnicolaescu summed it best, "What it is lacking is more spice and heat from the alcohol."...but a solid beer nonetheless. Its my second favorite Belgian dark ale...but again, its still a Belgian beer. #respectbeerbrethren

Bottled date? Im not going to look it up on their site. Aroma, light, cookie with a hint of raspberry? Long tasting day. Happy New Year! Beautiful appearance. Frothy light brown (Huge) head that lasts forever. Fair lacing, slightly hazy with a brown, almost purple colour.. Sweet initial flavour and fsirly long gingerbread like finish.light palate with an almost creamy texture. Fizzy and hides the 9 percent alcohol fairly well. Wow petow, cest bon en ta! This will be one of my go to beers from now on.
12 oz bottle pours a dark brown color with an off white head. Aromas of dark fruit, wine like. Full bodied, complex, nicely balanced, delicious.
Couleur brune foncé au reflet rougeatres. Aromes complexes de caramel, épices, fruits rouges, céréales, levure belge. Bon pour le style mais cest pas mon genre de bière... Sur évalué pour moi...

Bottle @ some brasserie in DC. Deep Chestnut brown with a large off white head. Nose is of sweet dark forest fruits. Estery. Plums, dark grape, raisin. Taste is kind of hot.. Brown bread with plum preserve. Quite spicy. Slightly thin.

Brune foncée, reflets ruby. Voilée. Mousse beige claire, persistante. Gros lacings.
Au nez très fruitée-sucré (fruits noirs plutôt). Maltage toasté chocolat. Epicée, légèrement poivrée. Caractère liquoreux. Et bien sûr levures Unibroue.
En bouche encore plus complexe et balancée. Avec une certaine douceur, très très légère acidité, petite amertume herbeuse. Alcool présent. Le tout incroyablement balancé et complexe. Grosse longueur finale, plutôt sucré, liquoreuse et herbeuse.
Bonne carbonatation avec du corps.
Jadore cette bière.

Bottle from the only. Very bright fruit aromas, cherry plum and grape, sweet fresh juicy aromas. Wine-like. Yeast heavy aroma and very bright. Chocolate notes are subtle, lively carbonation. Full bodied and rich. Deep opaque brown body with foamy brown head.

Bottle at 28 Springs with Peter. Pours a reddish brown with two fingers of off white head. Aron is malt dark fruits raisins and some chocolate. Flavor follows. Fairly sweet. Really nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark ruby-brown with a thick head that smooths out and lingers for a while. Aroma is classic Unibroue yeast, slightly peppery hops, spice, warm dough. Taste is very smooth, rich and slightly fruity with some spice and a full-bodied yeast presence. Good palate; body is present but light. Slightly sweet finish with lots of cooked malt.

12 oz foiled bottle poured. Pours midnight black with a lasting cloudy head. Mild dark fruit aroma with some plum and spice. Very flavorful with some grape, dark fruit, and a ton of spice. Slightly tart as well. Well worth the low cost. Great beer.

Dark mahogany colour with ruby notes, moderate sized beige head which disappears quickly; aroma of candy sugar, overripe fruits, yeast, some herbal liqueur notes and alcohol in the background; taste of toasted sugar, dried fruits, vanilla; herbal notes and spicy aftertaste - excellent Belgian strong ale from the new world

Near black pour/ red in light. Small, dense khaki cap. Aroma is roasty with a little funk. Not getting the fruits it boasts on the label. Flavor is slightly fruity, toasted malt, roasty, and yeasty. High quality brew. Nice rich body.
Pint at Epcot during Food and Wine Expo. Poured into a plastic pint cup. Dark opaque color. Aroma of roast and dry fruit. Taste more of the same, with a bit of roast. Very enjoyable.

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours a deep, dark, rich red-brown, rather like a well-buffed, well-aged cherry wood desk, while forming an impressively thick head of just barely off-white foam. Holding the beer to daylight reveals faint ruddy highlights in an otherwise cloudy brown delicious-looking mass. Even after minutes of dissipation, the head remains as a half-finger cap atop the brew.

S: Diabolically sweet, as one might expect from reading the side of the pack. Dark fruits swirl about a dance floor in the arms of candi sugar and that Unibroue yeast, to the background tune of sweet caramel malt. Plums, grapes, raisins, and cherries intermingle with one another, and theres no shortage of dark bready hints as well, from pumpernickel to rye.

T: Oh, a heady, heady brew this is for a malthead with a yen for yeast! The nose promised all and lied about none of it. The flavor profile explodes from the moment it passes the lips through the finish, all the various notes in harmony. The dark fruits swirl about a palate of sweet dark breads and candi sugars, with no one or even group of flavors taking center stage. The flavors remain balanced and strong through the finish, lingering sweet and sticky on the tongue.

M: Creamy and sticky, with a medium carbonation that fills it out nicely.

O: Unibroue knows its Belgian ales, that is indisputable. This is one of the finer offerings along those lines Ive had, and I come back to it time and again. Should I ever get to Belgium itself to sample ales from the source, my opinion may change, but until then - bravo, Quebecois!

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy brown with small beige head. Floral aroma, yeasty, spicy, light roasted malt, fruity (banana, peach). Medium sweet flavor, spicy, light roasted malt, fruity (banana, cherry, peach), yeasty, light sourness. Light carbonation, medium-bodied.
(Bottle) Smells slightly funky. Pretty dry. Nice! But I would say fairly average dark Belgian.
Bottle. Rich. Deep black color with fine head. A little spicy and bitter but easy to stock for the ABV.

BOTTLE 341ML from CH-303.

Look: opaque dark brown, biggish beige head.
Aroma: rich sweet and tart dried fruits, oxidized wine, wine barrel, spicy coriander notes, hints of nuts, some light alcohol notes, 
Taste: light fruity sweetness, winy, very light alcohol. The body is light but is fine. What it is lacking is more spice and heat from the alcohol. Excellent otherwise!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Best aroma I have ever smelled - sweet citrus mixed with trippel. Pour is brownish black with small lasting head. Taste is sweet caramel with an orange aftertaste. No bitterness or bite whatsoever - totally smooth. Wow, is this a mind-blowing beer.a Pl

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Bottle from a trade. A very dark mahoganey brown with a thick fast-dissipating head. A rich spicy malty beer aroma. The taste is fantastic dark pitted fruits, raisins, spice and malts. Sweetly complex without being cloying. Probably one of the best belgian ales I have had in awhile. ---- August 2016 ----   Unibroue Trois Pistole 2005 vintage

Was given this as a freebie in a trade. It looks nice with a deep brown aroma but minimal foam. 

The aroma is pretty good with big nutty toffee and light sherry oxidized notes. The taste is jammy, dark stone fruits, bright cherry, coriander and toffee plus milk chocolate. Much dryer than when fresh but it has held up remarkably well.

grosse brune foncé,obscure saveurs de fruits confits,chocolats subtile, sur une longue chaleur toute douce de levure belge typique dunibroue.un peut épicé,très pétillante pour une abt mais cest parfait comme ça! longue final qui réchauffe,Solide classique , ont passe toujours du bon temps avec la trois-pistoles,à boire température pièce selon moi

Aroma is ripe plums, yeast, some alcohol. Not as good or complex as I was expecting. Very nice looking dark reddish brown color. Off white head that shrinks quickly. More carbonated than I thought it would be. Tastes like a cross between a Belgian ale and a lager. Crisp because of the amount of carbonation. I am getting a cherry like taste and some other sweetness before the port wine aftertaste described on the bottle. Palate is good because of how unique it is. Heavily carbonated yet smooth. Overall I liked it, didn't love it. Probably won't buy again.
Sampled at Northgate Tasting. I must be missing something with this renowed Belgian Strong. Tasted with La Fin and Terrible, and this was my least favorite.
12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass..dark cherry pour with thin white head..aroma of dark fruits,malts,raisins..very dry,malty,sweet taste..more like a wine than a beer..not my thing.

Shared bomber. Watery brown appearance. Ripe dark fruit nose, but not prominent on the palate. Dull carbonation makes for a surprisingly light palate. High ABV cloaked. Okay, but may be better with a meal.
Bottle. Pours a dark copper color with a thin layer of beige head. Aroma of yeast, dark fruits, and spices. Taste of raisins, yeast, and spice.

"hides the 9% abv very well. fruity and yeasty aroma, same in the flavor with some maltiness as well. not as harsh as maudite, and therefore better. looks great, smells ok, and tasted good, if not great. the body is nice, and like i said, it hides the alcohol well, but the carbonation is still too heavy for me..."

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 330ml bottle served in a Chalice. 
A: Pours a cloudy dark brown color forming a huge and creamy compact beige head with good retention. It never disappears totally leaving some lingering and molasses lacings in the glass. S: Sweet nose. Strong notes of caramel malts dark fruits and spices. Notes of toffee, caramel malts, earthy yeasts, dry raisins, date fruit, licorice and coriander. Flowery and grassy hops. Hints of alcohol in the very end. T: As suggested by the nose, very fruity and sweet in the upfront. Strong notes of raisins, date fruit, Port wine, licorice, Candi sugar and nuts. Interesting and refreshing spicy notes in the mouth, hints of black pepper and coriander. Earthy yeasts and a delicate hoppy bitterness. A warming beer. M: Heavy and molasses body. Average carbonation. Persistent notes of caramel and dark fruits in the aftertaste. O: Extremely drinkable beer. Masterpiece. [ BA Review @ 12/20/2009 ]

Very Dark reddish brown color 2 fingers head. really fruity, cake fruits, figs and dark rosted malts in background. the taste is just amazing. first you taste the residual sugars from the grains that taste like ripe fruits and then comes the grainy and mellow taste that is typical from Unibroues Flagpole beers. very-well hidden alcohol again. not very hoppy but thats okay there enough going on in the taste to charm you on a cold day! might be their best strong ale ( without considering special editions or very rare brews) Ive actually read that its a quad... but they dont mention it everywhere... sure feels like it... then it hangs with the bests : trappist Rochefort and then some

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a hazy dark amberish brown with off-white/very light caramel head steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells of dark fruit, spices, and Belgian yeast. Malty, but balanced. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied mouthfeel. Could have a bit more body, but enjoyable nonetheless.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: pours with an enormous head that's light tan in color, dark amber color that practically makes it opaque 
Aroma: plum, sour apple, not as aromatic as I thought it would be, maybe some bread
Taste: moderate sweetness, very faint hints of chocolate, subtle notes of grass, Apple, 
Palate: faint chocolate aftertaste, average carbonation, leaves mouth wet, medium mouthfeel
Overall: this is a subtle beer but it feels like there is a lot under the surface, no trace of the abv so be careful, I feel like plum trappist beer is the best way to describe this, very good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the Beer Store. Dark brown with a one finger tan head that fades slowly to a sheet. Nose is dominantly dark fruit with grape, plum, and cherries. Mild yeast and toasted bread are also evident. Flavour is much like the nose with a moderate fruity tartness throughout over a light sweet toffee and vanilla. Mouth is medium full with soft carbonation.
Large bottle. Dark brown pour with a finger of tan head. Big aroma of dark fruit, some yeast, raisins, plums, bit of booze. Taste is dark fruit, with lots of rich maltiness. Nice and complex.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 750 ml bottle into a tulip glass. The label lists the abv at 9% and there a brief description on the back label. 
Appearance: The body has a dark brownish color with some lighter brownish amber highlights. It looks like it has a slight haze and it has lots of fine carbonation running up the sides of the glass. From the pour I got an inch of light tan foam. This foam fades slowly to ring of foam at the edge of the glass. A quick swirl excites the foam. Lacing is minimal.
Smell: Its aroma is very inviting and full of deep fruity and yeasty notes. I gets notes of red grapes, raisins, plums and over ripe pears. These notes are surrounded by a pleasant sweet bready maltiness with just the very slightest hint of the 9% abv. 
Taste / Palate: Like the aroma its flavor follows in its footsteps. The has a good full body with loads of malty, yeasty and dark fruitiness. I also get nice mild notes of vanilla extract along with some alcohol which adds another nice layer of complexity. Mouth feel is smooth and full with lots of soft carbonation.

Dark, rich, complex, awesome. These peoples make killer beer. Sweet label, too. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown with thin head. It has a subtle aroma of wine and dark fruit. Sports a complex fruity flavor with raisins, dark fruit, plum, sherry. Slight hint of sour, vinous aftertaste. Medium body. Slight warming. I enjoyed this quite a bit as a very different drinking experience than my current trend of Oktoberfest and the like. I wish I had more as I feel this would a great beer to enjoy over the course of a night spent next to the fire reading a good book. I drank the one I had while playing guitar so it wasn't really the mellow contemplative setting this beer deserves.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not a lot of dtetectable aroma. Pours a very dark brown with thin tan head. Very complex taste as added spices are evident. Very smooth and mellow. Good but not my favorite style.
Drought. Inky black with small off-white foamy head, very little caramel aroma, medium carbonation, mocha taste with a hint of sour cherry, long finish. Very smooth and balanced taste!

Famed Canadian ale in Belgian trappist or abbey beer style. Lots of dark malts, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, aromatic hops; well-balanced and tasteful but it also had a hint of DMS which disturbed me a little.
This beer is like nothing i have ever tried....rating is tough because it is so different for me...meady crazy dough bread flavor...my mouth was overwhelmed...3 more to drink then i shall rerate.

From 341 ml bottle. Pour is dark brown with almost no head. Nose is vinous port wine-like with strong notes of sweet dark fruits, mainly prunes and cherries. Fresh pie notes too. Taste is quite sweet with a long warm alcohol finish. Flavours of sweet fruit desserts with some vanilla and dough notes. This beer has definitely a unique character!

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkel- bis kastanienbraune Farbe, leicht trüb mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist karamellig, hefig, etwas rindig, warm und leicht röstig. Der Geschmack ist samtig, medium bodied, sonst wie das Aroma. Bittere kommt leicht im Nachgeschmack.

Color is dark brown. Aroma is sour, very ripe tropical fruit, sweet sugar. Taste is cherries, really ripe banana, some lemon and yeasty sourness backed. Quite sweet once it warms up a bit (and you should let it warm up - it improves dramatically). Booze is apparent and warming, but not overwhelming. Not a style I am a big fan of, but its obvious this is a very high quality brew.

Pours a dark brown nearly black color, with a nice light tan head. Very Cool bottle. Aroma is like dark fruits, dark malt. Taste is impressive, dark malty, with hints of said fruit, yet balanced and very good. Very drinkable no bitterness or harshness. Some light alcohol taste, not enough to be overpowering, it does let you know its there! Over all excellent beer!!

12 oz bottle poured into sensory glass. Pours a dark brown with purplish red undertones. A medium tan head appears which subsides after a couple of minutes to a thin veil, sparse lacing.

Smell is pungent dark fruits up front - plums, cherries and raisins, mainly. The alcohol is also apparent, with some chocolate and a bit of an herbal quality. 

Taste is exactly what you expect from the aroma. Lots of sweet, dark fruits up front, with a touch of chocolate and alcohol spiciness. Under that initial blast, you can taste some hops, which help to balance the sweetness of the beer and it does a good job. Reminded of dark chocolate on top of tart, dark cherries. This ends up being dry on the finish, despite the sweet smell and initial flavors. Very easy drinking for a strong dark. Mouthfeel is smooth and bubbly.

Overall, an excellent strong dark Belgian ale. Way too easy going down at 9%.

drink cold (10°C).
Eye: strong dark brown/black beer with beige, almost brown head. nice bottle with the typpic Unibroue bottleneck aluminium wrapping.
Nose: you can smell the yeast. chocolate, dark fruits. slight sidenotes of mushrooms or some sort of sweet soap, alcohol too.
Mouth: chocolate, dark fruits such as blackcurrant, plums and raisins, also oriental fruit like figs and dates. very round and butterlike when it runs down.
Overall: reminds me of the great rochefort 10°, but nit just as balanced. ill definitely drink this one again. one of my favourites.
Aroma is earthy, dark fruit, and alcohol. Appearance is dark nice white head and some lacing. Taste is strong alcohol is up front nice strong beer.. Alcohol is a bit overwhelming though

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours dark brown with a redish hue, small head that dissipates quickly leaving behind a fine lace. Aroma of dark fruits, currants, bread, belgian yeast / banana funk, and caramel. Taste is banana, cherries, other fruits, a little funk, slight alcohol, and grass. Medium to heavy body, light carbonation. This is an interesting beer with a lot of complexity. Strong but not overly boozy, with a slight bite at the end to balance out the strong flavors. Pretty damn good.

Refined beer. Pleasant blend of caramel malts with Belgian yeast. Some hints of spice. Soft burnt caramel color with a good head. Full palate without being too heavy. Complimenting carbonation. Alcohol was present but not distracting. Strong bready malt flavors with some sweetness with toast and spice from the yeast. A little molasses as well. Quite good.
Pours a dark brownish color. Aroma and taste are dark fruit and roasted malts.

Pours a very dark red/amber colour with some head thats thick but dissipates. Aroma is lots of caramel and some belgian sweetness. Taste is full bodied and well carbonized. Generally on the sweet side but more of the caramel comes through with practically none of the high alcohol content. Aftertaste is nice and round with some hints of candy/bubblegum. No real bitterness but no real sweetness either. Very balanced all the way through. Extremely drinkable!

Bottle bought at the Beerstore in Hamilton/Canada picked by my good friend and craft beer geek Erik. Im a European on vacation in Canada and well know all the Belgian ales available in stores, so he wanted to pick a Canadian belgian style ale for me to taste. Overall a tasty beer, not so mind blowing like Westmale but stil good.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

500ml bottle ($2.51).

Nice herb aroma. Pours black with tan head. Medium sweet taste. Full bodied with creamy texture and average carbonation. Very good strong beer.

Very dark Belgium strong ale. Delicious and rich. Delivered in a 750ml bottle. Awesome.
