Dark brown with a tan head, aroma holds floral notes. Taste is sweet with hints of grape and raisin, finish similar to a port.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Transfer from BA review on 5-16-12- 
Served in a 10 oz chalice glass

Appearance  Served a dark brownish brew with a reddish tint. Upon serving there was a light white head that faded rapidly to give a medium level of lacing.

Smell  The aroma is heavy of dark fruits with notes of roasted malt and brown bread. It is mixed with a light yeast, spice and chocolate aroma. It is quite nice.

Taste  The taste starts out as dark fruit and cocoa. Its a nice dark chocolate covered cherry and raisin taste mixed with a brown bread flavor. As the taste advances the fruit and the bread remain but the chocolate begins to fade. In the middle some tastes of yeast and a light spice come to the tongue. From there a lighter caramel and toffee sweetness mix. All these flavors persist to the end where they are met with a lighter alcohol flavor that leaves a warming sweet taste on the tongue.

Mouthfeel  The body is on the creamier side with a medium level of carbonation. Both are quite fitting for the sweeter complex flavors of the brew. The body provides enough thickness to where it can really permeate the tongue while the carbonation suits the sweeter flavors well.

Overall  A very nice tasting Belgian dark. A great flavor profile with a wonderful aroma and feel. A brew to try.

Aroma: Dark fruit aromas with hints of wine.
Appearance: Dark brown with a tan head that dissipates quickly.
Taste: Light sweetness balanced by a light sourness in the finish. 
Palate: Medium body, thick texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Rich and complex tastes, very much like a well aged wine. Very solid beer. I would seek this out again.
Floral, citrus, and fruity aroma, big tan head. Taste fruit, spice and hint of chocolate, moderate carbonation. Would pair well with Creole or spicy food.
12 oz bottle. Poured a hazy reddish brown color with a frothy tan top. Taste of Belgian yeast, plum, fig, slight alcohol. High carbonation, medium body. Unibroue is amazing!
Pours a dark, dark brown with two-inch thick head. Dark fruit, cherries, figs on the nose. Bready, sweet malts, bananas, slightly tangy citrus. A really wonderful Belgian-style ale.

Poured from a bottle. Medium reddish brown color, short lived tan fizzy head. Mild sour malt aroma. Medium sweet and mild bitter flavor with a light finish and a fizzy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured into a chalice.
The appearance was a nice ruddy brown color with a one finger white foamy head that died within about a minute. It left a nice stringy foamy lacing.
The smell had a good amount of raisins, honey, and plums making it fairly sweet.
The taste was basically sweet and allowing a decent amount of Belgian spices come in to start to take over as it warmed a bit.
On the palate, it sat about a medium on the body and showing that this is more of a sipper and had a good smooth carbonation about it.
Overall, I say this was a good Belgian Strong ale well worthy of having again and quite possibly as a nice dessert by itself at the end of the day.

Pours a dark brow with quick fading fluffy white head. Aromas of dark fruit roasted malt spice and a earthy funk. Taste is sweet dark fruit, malt and yeast. Medium body nice carbonation. Best belgian style ale Ive had besides rocheforte and westveleteren.

12oz bottle poured into a tulip-- Opened the bottle and it foamed over the top before I could get the glass underneath. Whats in the glass is dark, with a tint of darkness. Nice head but doesnt last, reminds me of a couple of old girlfriends. Dark does not equal sweet except here. Nice sweet aroma. Id tell you it has a fig aroma and taste but the only figs Ive ever had were Newtons so how would I know. Strong sweet taste and you can tell there is alcohol present. Overall a really good beer.

Highly carbonated. Extremely dark appearance. Head dissipates quickly, very active. Light oatmeal and almond flavors, grapefruit, cherry, plum and other dark fruit flavors, malty finish. My new favorite from Unibroue

11/9/2013

Unibroue Trois Pistoles
A  5  Nice dark murky brown almost black color with a nice half finger head of off white head. Cool Unibroue bottle. Nice lacing left on the glass
Aroma  9  Really nice crisp belgain yeast smell. Dark fruits  cherrys, strawberries, blackberries, plums, figs. Bready malt. Banana. Smarties, sweet candy sugar.
T  10  Sweet candi sugar, cherry, strawberry, blueberries, blackberries, plums, figs, bready malts, banana. Very crisp and smooth. Definitely has a very distinct Unibroue taste.
Palate  5  Light-medium feel for a dark strong ale. Alc covered at 9% (impressive). Aftertaste is bready malt, belgian yeast and banana. But so smooth and crisp. Its refreshing as hell.
O  19  Its really excellent. I cant find much wrong with this beer. At 9% the alc is completely covered. And bottle conditioned its got a light mouthfeel, no harshness at all.

What a fantastic treat! Love this beer the complex flavor, aroma and look was just great! Cant believe its 9% , its so smooth

Pours nearly black with a bubbly light brown head that lasts and lasts. Smells of plum and yeast. Both carry over to the taste, along with alcohol. Just a touch of sourness. Medium mouth with lots of carbonation. The aftertaste doesnt linger long. This isnt a bad beer, but its not my favorite style.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2014 Belle apparence dark brown et aussi très gazéifiée pour le style. Larôme degage une belle combinaison fruits sauvages & malt. Elle développe un gout assez complexe de fruits sauvages, chocolat & rhum brun... sur ce gout de levure caractérisque aux produits Unibroue: ce qui lui donne un goût plus rough, ou enfin un goût plus sauvage pour une  quadrupel.  Cela lui confère un goût unique.  La Trois-Pistoles est une ROCKSTAR!!! ;)

Pours dark with a thin head. Fruity smell. Light and crisp palatte kinda like cider and bubbly. Can hardly taste the alcohol even though its 9%. Easy to drink slight bitterness but not much. Good beer overall..

12 oz. bottle. Pour is a deep Crimson brown, hazy, with a khaki head no lacing. Smell is dark deep roasted dark fruits, citrusy spice and yeast. Taste is massive dark fruits: plum, cherries, fig. Yeasty spiciness which is maybe a bit assertive, but does cleanse the palate for the next sip. Overall a solid Belgian.

750 ml pour best before 5-26-14..fairly dark brown color that is really only visible when in the light..ultimately left a tan ring head resting atop..good amount of carbonation and sound after some cork struggle..aroma is indeed ripe fruit with plum..black cherry and spices abound..mouthfeel is light-medium bodied with really no trace of the abv..does have noticeable vinous presence and an overall easy beer to enjoy with a dry finish that manages to coat the palate..tasty belgian dark strong ale
A dark brown beer with a small tan head. The aroma is fruity, esters, yeast. The flavor is berries and sugary roasted malts.

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy dark brown color with small creamy tan-like head, good lacing and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of dark fruits, wine, caramel, yeast and subtle alcohol. Taste starts with sweet toasted malt and burnt sugar, follows refreshing yeasty and fruity with warming alcoholic mouthfeel and light bitter finish. Full body, creamy texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Smooth, rich and potent brew...
Flavors of blackberries, tart cherries, bread, cola and white cake with hints of yeast and clove. Great beer, well balanced and unique.

Pours a hazy dark brown with a foamy off-white head. Has a strong aroma of dark fruits. Taste is dominated by dark fruits, and there is a touch of bitterness in the finish. Has a full body feel. Overall this is quite good, though I feel as if there could be a touch more to the flavor. Maybe a second try will be more favorable.
Poured into brandy snifter. Have not seen this in my area, so thanks to my girlfriend for bringing it back from a trip. Really unique brew. Great for a winter evening.
Standard Unibroue: really good. Kept in the cellar for a year. Highly recommended beer.
Might of been the batch but I got a strong metallic taste! Had a nice phenol smell to it and a nice bready taste twards the end of the pallet.

The Trois Pistoles pours a dark brown to plumb color with a very light tan head that lasts for all eternity and continues to be fed into. The aroma is somewhat light, but dark fruit stands out. The flavor is dark fruit with a hint of bread and a little roasty. Overall this beer is delicious. It is a well brewed Belgian.

This is a terrific Belgian style ale. Comparable with some of the bests of the style.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap very dark brown with small white head. Taste is light spice with hints of fruit with just a trace of alcohol. Very smooth and balanced. A great sipper to enjoy.

Pours a dark brown with a nice pinkish white head that fades rather quickly. The aroma is fruity with bread and an earthy smell. The taste is malty mixed with bread and fruit. Moderate carbonation and a great beer.
Bottle pouts murky dark brown with big carb and yeast flotillas. Aroma is right sweet dark fruits and light Belgian spice. Taste is similar with a smooth sweet mouth feel.

Dark burgundy in color with slight head and no carbonation. Smell of dark fruits, bananas, raisins. Tastes smooth and fruity like a port wine with a slight alcohol burn on the finish. Excellent example of a Belgian style strong Dark Ale. Very similar to a nice quad. Highly recommend this beer.
This is a nice strong Belgian. Yeast is readily apparent, but not obtrusive. It is best sipped, and I drank it semi-chilled. Fruity and quite rich.

En terme de rapport qualité/prix, la Trois-Pistoles est ce quil y a de mieux au Québec à mon humble avis. Des flaveurs de fruits confits et de fruits secs émanent dun liquide brun et voilée dont les grosses bulles forment une mousse couleur crème qui part rapidement. Une odeur chocolatée sajoute aux autres pour créer un bouquet complexe. Suave et langoureuse en bouche, le sucre dorge et lalcool enveloppent le palais. Très pétillante pour le style, on passe toujours un bon moment avec cette bière.

On numerous occasions 341ml and 750ml bottles. Murky amber-brown body, big mocha head with good retention, no lacing. Aroma of plums, brown sugar, coriander, Unibroue yeast, sour cherries. Taste strongly yeasty, figs, candy sugar, caramel, dark berries, plums, spices. Effervescent.

Cloudy brown/amber with a persistent lace. Fruity and spicy aroma, with biscuit notes as well. Flavor is malty and sweet, with a hint of dried fruit. Very crisp and carbonated for a Dark Strong Ale. Definitely a potent, sipping beer, with a nice warming effect. This is one Ill return to on many occasions. Another strong Unibroue offering.
Bottle. Deep brown with a medium, dark tan head. Dark, tart fruit and caramel. Dark sugar, tannins and berries.

Murky dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is chocolate, raisins, dates, cherry, pepper and bread. Taste is caramel, molasses, chocolate, plums, spices and licorice. Medium body, lively carbonation

Poured into tasting glass. Pours a deep purplely brown. Some head and lacing but not much. Aroma was complex. Hard to nail down but I got some dark fruit, chocolate, coffee. Taste was yeast, coffee and chocolate. The finish was raisans and fig. With the ABV I expected a alcohol finish but it is well hidden. Sweet and warming, perfect for the snowy winter we have been having. Mouth feel was oily without being to thick.
1 Feb 2014, tap. dark ruby. nose is blue fruit and some alcohol, rather sweet. thin body and mildly fizzy. some burnt toast, figs or plums, slightly astringent alcohol. decent.
Awesome belgian strong ale, bomber thanks to Josh, drank on new years, sweet, rich
From notes. Pours a murky brown with a big head. Aromas of fruits and yeast. Sweet with big carbonation.

12oz bottle poured into tulip. Very dark brown with a half-finger of tan head that recedes to a ring and some cells of bubbles. Smells of cherries, chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, bread, and fig. Taste is grassy, pear and apple on warming, cherries, figs, dates, spicy alcohol notes, and grains. Medium-full body, oily and creamy texture, lively carbonation, dry and spicy finish. Definitely improves as it warms.

12 oz. bottle from Gator Beverage in Gainesville. Pours a deep dark brownish purple with a nearly two finger creamy off white to khaki head. Big time dark fruit aroma , candy sugar, molasses, spicy Belgian yeast funk, as expected. Flavor is sweet and fruity up front with plums, cherries, pears, raisins. The finish ends with a good bit of spices that linger and play around with the sweet fruits on the tongue afterward. Medium heavy body with medium carbonation. Plenty of body but not chewy, which makes this plenty drinkable and pleasant. Nice for dessert or for anything else. Excellent BSA and there is a reason it is up there with the best of the style. Right on with all the flavors.
Beautiful dark Belgian ale. Nothing particularly outstanding, but a solid beer.
La meilleure parmie toute les bière goûter ça va toujours rester la meilleur et ça vien dici

I think this is a great beer. It has a lot going for it but at the same time is missing a bit in the middle. I dont mind the carbonation taking over at the front, and the sweet malt fighting for a place, but there is a gap after that, no carry, and you end with the astringent note. This doesnt make it bad it makes it a bit less then perfect. This does have a cracking amount of raisin and other similar fruits, it has a great colour, but little or not head. You might like the up front fizz that distracts you from the delivery, but you might miss the middle as I did. Nearly but not quite

341ml bottle. Murky dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is chocolate, raisins, dates, cherry, pepper and bread. Taste is caramel, molasses, chocolate, plums, spices and licorice. Medium body, lively carbonation, creamy texture.

Pours a dark, plum reddish color, complete with a foamy head at the top about two fingers high that fizzles down to a modest ring over the first minutes of consumption. Viscous in appearance, and cloudy as well. Isn't too showy, but looks good.

Contains a similar flavor profile at the front reminiscent to Maudite, with a larger focus on the spices, as well as dark fruits. For a year round offering, this flavor provides most seasonal winter warmers a run for their money: cinnamon, ginger, clove, and allspice, as well a load of black pepper at the finish. Dark fruits are very prominent, especially of the darker variety - raisins, prunes, and figs, to name a few. Finishes with a caramel/toffee flavor that melds with a mild bitterness to round out the spices and any potential sweetness. Slightly spicy, but nothing too intense. The alcohol is hidden rather well, especially at 9%. Really good - exactly what I'd expect from this brewery.

The flavor is a bit different, and is a little less heavy on the spices, as well as displaying a rigorous amount of maltiness and dried fruit character. Caramel is immediately at the front, followed by a little bit of chocolate. After, notes of raisins and prunes immediately wash away the sweetness, followed by a grainy bitterness, and a little bit of the spices mentioned earlier (cinnamon is the most predominant). The yeast is present here, especially with the bottle's age, and while the hops are faded, there is a mild herbal bitterness at the finish (which is close to black tea in flavor). Not too carbonated, but very full in character and comforting to drink. A solid dark Belgian-style ale.

This appeals to me with a bit of age as the sweetness is usually cut down dramatically with a bit of time. This delivers all the goods that a spiced, dark ale of this nature should have - dried, dark fruitiness, some spices, minimal sweetness, and little bit of that unique, wild Belgian yeasty character. This isn't even from Belgium and it's more enjoyable than half of the basic dark ales that come from there. I don't usually drink beers like this anymore but this is a very welcome addition to my cellar from time to time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma of raisins, plums, chocolate and a touch of cloves. Flavours of raisins, plums, dates, bread and a bit of spiciness. Very tasty. I thought it was a little light bodied for a Quad, but a stellar beer nonetheless. One of my favourites from Unibroue.

Pours an amber brown color with a fizzy off white head. Malt, caramel, toffee, spice, clove, yeast and fruit aroma. Cherry, raisin, plum, malt, yeast, spices, biscuit, caramel, clove and light hop flavors. Medium body with lots of carbonation. Sweet with a fruity finish.
I must say I am pleased. Delivers in all aspects. All equally impressive with no one aspect overshadowing. Balanced.

75cl bottle into tulip. Minneapolis.

Appearance: Dark brown/ruby with tan head. Lacing on glass. 

Aroma: Dark fruits, raisin, molasses, licorice, spicy notes.

Taste: Mostly sweet in taste. Some bitterness towards the end. Small hint of warning alcohol. 

Palate: Pretty full bodied. Smooth mouthfeel. Longer finish. 

Overall: A really nice beer. Full of flavor and body.

Bottle poured a dark brown hue w/ large fizzy fully diminishing tan head. Moderate to bold sweet fruity aromas. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a light bitter finish. Tastes are Belgian sugar, Belgian yeast, figs, roasted malts, and port wine. Full bodied, lively carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, and warm finish.

Pours a somewhat murky brown with a touch of amber and about .5 of head. There is a lot of carbonation. Aroma is Belgian yeast, dark fruits, apples and pears. Taste follows the nose with some spice mixed in. Full bodied with above average carbonation and a dry finish.

Corked bottle. Dark plum color. Dark fruit and slight alcohol aroma with some sourness. Slight sour fruit, tartness, but not overpowering. Has good Belgian strong qualities, but missing the authentic Belgian flavors we love.

Corked large bottle poured into a tulip glass. Deep plum with a little head. Aroma is filled with tart fruit and kind of malty/biscuity. Taste is wonderful. Sweet, malt, plum. Well rounded taste...nearly perfect balance and easy to drink. Good work Unibroue! Please seek this out as soon as possible.
Fruity aroma but orange&cherry pronounced. It pours a opaque dark brown colour. Taste: smoked nuts with notes of fig. Lively carbonation.
Really good. Sweet at first then becomes dry. Black Cherry. Hint of Tart. Hides alcohol well.

Best by: 10/11/2013

A: pours a hazy dark brown with a single finger of loose peanut foam which dissipates nearly immediately to a broken and struggling to retain its presence. Little lacing. 

S: smells like latex paint. There are some hints of coriander and dark, sweet malts. Overall, the yeast dominates as it does in the majority of Unibroue beers.

T: Man, Ive tried the lineup of Unibroue beers many times. I keep hoping I will get it. The beer is sweet, yeasty, chemical, just plain difficult to drink for me.

M: Medium body with high carbonation. Dry finish.

O: Sorry guys, I just cant get on board with this one.

Serving type: bottle

05-26-2011

355ml bottle into a trappist glass; served cool.

Aroma: Sour yeast, sourdough bread. A little apricot and mild booze.

Appearance: Near opaque, hazy, tawny body. No head.

Taste: Bubblegum! Thats a new one. Strawberries/cherries. Some yeast/spice on the end.

Palate: Moderate gentle carbonation. Medium body, moderate-long spiced finish.

Overall: Quite pleasant! Flavors were unexpected and great!

Botella de 33 cl en la abadia en agosto de 2011. Muy buena y ya lamentablemente muy difícil de encontrar. Color negro con espuma algo oscura poco persistente. Cuerpo medio - fuerte. Sabores dulces a licor y ligero toque de madera de Oporto. Muy buena habrá que seguir buscando para hacerse con una
750 ml. bottle. Pours a dark cherry brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of fruit, malt, spice, and yeast. Taste is dark sweet fruit, malt, yeast, spice, and caramel. Excellent.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark reddish-brown with a tan head. Taste dark fruits, belgian yeast, tart. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bouteille 750ml de brune. arome de porto, d?alcool, de melasse et notes de fruit. gout puissant mais bien équilibré avec un gout de caramel de l?acidité et une belle amertume.

Pours a cola and bourbon cocktail-brown with a large, fizzy, tan head. Cola nose with some mild Belgian notes. Full body. Much, much less carbonation than the liveliness on the pour would suggest. A touch of red wine vinegar, apple, prune, a pinch of tobacco, and cherry flavors. Some balancing bitterness toward the finish. Good brew.
Deep red/burgundy with very little head. Lots of cherry and plum flavor yet very mellow alcohol taste for a big beer. Drinks like a port wine. Great with a dark cigar.

12 oz. bottle. Dark burgundy color, with a thin, beige head. The aroma is caramel, and cola-esque, with notes of cherries, milk chocolate, cloves, and syrup. The flavor is very sweet, with a light tartness and pretty strong, savory spice. Heavy body, sticky, and very effervescent. This beer is delicious, and the mouthfeel is perfect.
Yeast, fruit, spice and malt on the nose. Complex flavours- plum, cherries, chocolate. Smooth but hot. Lingering taste. Pours dark with nice head. This is a serious bear .

This deep black colored beer has a sweet inviting aroma. It has flavors of raisins and oats. Very well put together. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 750 ml into a Spiegelau tulip. DISCLAIMER: its Unibroue night and Ive had several 750s prior to this. 

A: Very spicy in the nose, with coriander and pepper on top of a mix of caramel and cherries. The identifying Unibroue yeast is strongly present in the nose. 
A: Pours a beautiful dark reddish brown color with a small tan head that quickly disappears.
T: Follows the nose, but not exactly. Complex dark fruit notes (dates, raisins, chocolate covered cherries) with cocoa, toffee, light vanilla notes, light notes of Belgian yeast and green apple. 
P: Medium body and moderate carbonation. 
O: Perhaps the best beer from Unibroue. A world-class Belgian strong dark ale. I have to imagine that the Belgians are worried about getting out-Belgianed by some Canadians.

Bottle. Dark black pour, lasting fizzy quarter inch head and an aroma of boozy plums. Flavor was nice creamy malty plums, hints of black cherries and alcohol and finished with a warming aftertaste. Solid and well priced.
Love this beer. One of my favs. Dark but not heavy good percent abv. No alcohol warmth really. Taste of raisins, stone fruits, belgium yeast. Not over powered by malts. Excelento

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Dark brown with cherry edges and a creamy tan head that disipates into a thin cap. Aroma is malt, belgian yeast, dark ripe fruit, sugar and spice. Fairly sweet with a dry finish, some alcohol warmth. Full body, very smooth. Very nice beer.

Bottle at the Bier Garden in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Pours a deep dark cherry with a thin eggshell head. Not much lacing. Aroma of sweet, dark fruits and spices. Taste is amazing. Sweet dark fruits, spices, hoppy bitterness to balance. Creamy full body. Finishes slightly dry like a wine.

Corked bottle. Best by 11/20/15. Such a great beer. Ripe dark fruits and Belgian yeast from a deep but clear mahogany colored ale with a pillowy off white head. Tastes like sweet dark ripe fruits and spices with some yeasty notes and a touch of alcohol. Silky smooth body. Really an outstanding beer.

Appearance with dark amber (almost black) color and high head.
Fruity (floral hops) and toasted malty aroma.
Sweet (ripe fruit), chocolate and port wine flavor.
An excellent Belgian Dark Strong Ale.
Unibroue Quality!

From bottle. Dark clear amber brown color with fizzy head. Aroma is bubblegum, sweet spice, and roasted malting. Taste is cola, roasted malt, clove, and a touch of liqueur alcohol. Effervescent and light mouthfeel with a sweet and slightly spiced roasted finish.

10/25/13 bottle - pours clear dark amber with quickly dissipating head. Nose is complex blend of Pinot noir, malt, yeast, and cloves. Taste is also of red wine, cloves, malt, and maple syrup. Very dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

poors a bit hazy, dark beer, not like a stout, but still pretty dark. light head not creamy. nose is nice, not powerfull, subtile but fantastic. you can smell the roasted malts. realy light taste for a 9%abv, well equilibrated, with chocolate, roast, bit of caramel. long lasting after taste, nice palate. carbonation is medium high,really refreshing for a strong beer, quite impressed. its a must try!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I really liked this one. Definitely malty with the caramel and chocolate sweetness. Spicy, though not as spicy as other beers with that label. Belgian yeast flavor is not subdued as it can be in the darker brews. An all around balanced take on the strong dark ale; one that probably sets the standard for the type.

Pours dark brown color with off white head. Aromas of dried fruits and Belgian yeasts. Flavors of a mild sweet dried fruits with the traditional Belgian yeast that makes this one well worth the money. Ive only had two of this brewerys beers, but both have been stellar!

A: Deep Brown/Reddish hue, Foamy Off White head, Great Lacing

S: Sweet Fruit, Raisins, Deep Malts, mild Yeast

T: Raisins, Plums, Belgian Sugar, Smoothe Finish

M: Well Carbonated, Medium Bodied, Sweet, Crisp

Overall, a solid Belgian Strong Ale with a solid yet smoothe finish.

This beer has a pretty strong taste to it but does not have a lingering effect that many other strong beers have. Also, even though it is 9% alcohol, it is quite easy to drink. Very good overall beverage.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Trop sucrée pour moi, mais sans tomber dans lexcès. Un peu trop mince comme corps, un peu trop carbonisé (tire sur la consistence du champagne). À ne pas consommer trop froide. Cache lalcool dune manière phénoménale (il y a vraiment de lalcool là dedans?). Appréciée, occasionnellement.
Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Strong aroma of fruit and malt. Smells and tastes of plums. Very nice. Easy drinking for 9%.
Pours dark brown to black with light fizzy head, like a cola soda. Aroma is sweet malt with dried fruit raisin prune. Taste is slight sweetness very smooth.
Dark malt aroma with hints of dark fruit/raisons. A bit chewy, fairly big mouthfeel. Dark fruit elements with a good bit of sugar. Slow sipper, but alcohol is well integrated.

Bottle served in a tulip. Pours dark cola in color with a short head. Bright aroma of dark fruit, cheese, and Belgian yeast. Some vinous notes as well. Medium sweet flavor. Medium body, fizzy carbonation that settles to a sticky texture and a dry finish. Excellent.

Bouteille de 750 ml. 4,98$ en spécial chez IGA. Jai bu cette bière pour la première fois en 2008, je commençais à mintéresser à la bière et je navais pas trop apprécié. Je lai finalement réessayé 5 ans plus tard avec des amis et jai été très surpris de voir à quel point mes goût avaient évolués. La Trois-Pistoles est pratiquement parfaites, odeur de fruits confits enivrantes, couleur brune avec reflets rubis, belle mousse brune assez consistante, la levure et épices classiques Unibroue sont facilement décelables mais agrémentent à merveille les Belgian Strong. Ce nest pas une bière pour les buveurs de Molson... sinon, rapport qualité/prix ça va être difficile de trouver mieux!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Bière brune rouge, bien voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dun col brunâtre, dense et résistant. Arômes de levure belge (typiquement Unibroue!), pain légèrement grillé, caramel, léger chocolat, épices (anis, clou de girofle, muscade, piment de la Jamaïque), fruits foncés bien mûrs (du raisin surtout, mais aussi des prunes et des cerises noires), et même de la banane. Nez riche et très complexe, belle intensité, très agréable, ça met en appétit! En bouche, pétillement élevé sur la langue, breuvage bien mousseux, onctuosité intéressante au palais. Au goût, domination de la levure et des épices, avec une pointe dalcool, le tout donnant un effet très chaleureux en bouche. Aussi, saveurs de pain légèrement grillé, caramel, léger chocolat, avec des fruits foncés significativement plus subtils en bouche quau nez. Lamertume est plutôt faible, mais tout de même bien présente. Belle complexité, intensité adéquate, excellente bière. On dit que le vieillissement est très bénéfique à cette bière. Personnellement, jai dégusté de la Trois-Pistoles vieillie jusquà 3 ans et 9 mois que jai trouvé moins pétillante et moins amère, pour un résultat plus doux, plus velouté, plus rond et plus harmonieux. En vieillissant, les saveurs maltées de fruits foncés, de caramel et de chocolat deviennent un peu plus évidents, mais on ne peut pas dire que ça change significativement la personnalité de la bière cependant.
Bottle. Color hazy brown with medium brown head. Aroma malt, yeast, spicy, orange. Taste sweet, orange, wood, spicy.

An odd beverage, flavor is just not there. Not really anything there. Low carbonation, hardly any bitterness, little yeast flavor, minimal alcohol taste, just not much. I guess you could call this refined beauty or boring crap, so I rated it down the middle. Things pick up a bit as it warms, but still.

Pours hazy brown-orange with a noisy, bubbling slightly off white head that settles to a finger or less. Aroma is strong and spicy with faint fruit (cherry) and gives a sense of impending dark - ale. Taste is a bold and rich pivot from the aroma. Fruity plum, grape and roasted malt with spices and a mild alcohol finish that reminds me very much of port wine. Outstanding. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle. Pours dark mahogany colour. Poured thick head off white head. No lacing. Fruity aroma. Flavour is complex but very smooth. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark pour. Sweet tastes of fruit with sour after taste. The aroma is inviting oh a sweet fruity aroka.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2013 Bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with light tan head. Aroma is fruits- raisin, oranges, yeast, malts. Taste is sweet. Medium bodied, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Finish is long sweet and very mild bitter.
Dark red pour. No head little lacing. Dark fruits raisans. Very smooth. Complex but good. Really likr it.

Pours a dark brown with a thins head and light lacing.sweet aroma of grapes and currants. Similar flavor to the scent, sweet aftertaste like a red wine. Very pleasant and worth trying...more than once.

Bottle- Pours a dark mahogany brown with no head or a huge tan head.(seems to be hit and miss with different bottles) Aroma is big on dark fruit, plum, chocolate. Flavor is port, dark fruit. Palate was highly carbonated with a dry finish. Overall this is one of my favorites if you get a good bottle, and still very good when you dont. I have tried the corked and caged bottles and the regular capped bottles, and the quality is never consistent. Still a great beer.
Tasted on tap at Brew in Chesterfield. Dark rich brown, creme head, sweet caramel, ginger aromas; fruity, nutty, sweet, caramel, orange, coriander tastes.
Bottle. Dark belgian strong ale heavy on roasted malt, dark fruit, and a bit boozy. Good beer.

750ml corked and caged bottle. Pours a rich mahogany brown color with a huge frothy tan head. Complex aroma of roasted nuts, caramel, toffee, cocoa, and dark fruits. Taste of dark fruits (plums, cherries, red grapes), nutty roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Enjoyed this beer with a cigar. Complimented each other very well.
Bottle. Very dark with a thin head. Aroma is wine and lees. Flavor is port, cinnamon, spices and dried fruit. Very flavorful and sweet.

Bottle. Pours cloudy deep reddish brown with a medium to large tan head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is spiced, molasses, dried fruit, yeast. Flavor is medium sweet and quite spiced with a bit of orange zest. Medium body, fizzy carbonated mouthfeel. ABV is well masked.

En fût au bistro l'autre oeil. Brune. Opaque. Reflet rougeâtre. Beau collet. Nez: sucre. Fruité. Noix. Bouche. Belle effervescence. Sucré mais pas trop. Levure typique Unibroue. Caramel. Chaleur d'alcool. Fruité. Fruit séché. Très peu d'amertume. Un côté malté bien équilibré. Orange confite. Un peu épicé (à la Noël), mais rien de brusque. Un chef d'oeuvre québécois.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 Pours with a finger head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is malt and fruit. Taste is malt and fruit as well with some alcohol at the finish. Excellent taste. Will buy again.

Pours a dark clear brown with a foamy cream head that fizzes away and leaves a thin layer on top. Aromas of caramel malts, dried fruit, and spices. Medium body with a very warm taste. Lots of complexity and depth. Tasty.

very fruity and malty, caramel, a little yeasty. Very strong but not too heavy. Tastes ends with a decent alcohol burn. Raisins, alcohol, sweet malt, prunes. Very alcoholy. sweet and malty, similar to the aroma.

Medium ruby brown. Fluffy beige head that fizzes away to a wispy topping. Interesting aroma; Quite yeasty, fruity, sweet malty, alcohol - very inviting. Medium body. Fairly complex.. Malty, fruity, some spices, alcohol. Finish is warming. Soft. smooth, nicely balanced.

Bottle - big foamy head, very dark brown almost black color, nice fruity Belgian yeast spice aroma and flavor, sweet roasted malt, complex profile - excellent as to be expected from this one

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Full of dark fruit and malt. Pours a cloudy black color with thin head. The taste is very sweet and only a hint of bitterness on the finish.
Pours a reddish-brown with a foamy, lasting head. Aroma of sweet fruits. Complex taste of sweet malts and dried malts. Satisfying, well made beer.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: 0.5L mug
From: Trader Joes in Goleta, Calif. 
Price: $8.99 for a variety 4-pack
Purchased: July 5, 2013
Consumed: July 6, 2013
Misc.: Best before Oct. 26, 2015; Foil wrap on bottle cap

Poured a mahogany brown color with 5-6 fingers of frothy khaki tan head. Decent among of lacing on the sides - thick & sporadic. Great retention on the top on the way down.

Smelled malty foam at first. Got dark roasty nutty malts, caramel, toffee, cocoa, chocolate, dark fruits (apple, grape, plum and slight cherry). 

Tasted similar to the nose. First thing I noticed was the warming, smooth finish. Dark fruits really come through - plum, cherry, grape, apple, pear. The roasted nuts dont come through as much as the smell. Still got some cocoa, caramel and toffee. Cloves come in as well.

Full-to-medium body. Slick texture. Average carbonation. Long-lasting smooth finish.

Just got better as it went down. Definitely want to try this again. Very good beer.

Aroma of deep caramel, spices. Pours almost ebony black, with thick tan head that lasts. Seems a bit too dark. Sweet fruit, malt, hint of spices, strange twang of wheat/yeast??? Finishes with some bitterness, mild alcohol burn and some sweetness. Different style than Im used to as a Belgian strong.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Bomber poured into snifter. Pour is a murky caramel brown with a 1/4-inch khaki head that clings to the top, leaving thick, soapy lacing when I tilt the glass. Aroma Aroma is prunes, candy, caramel, faint malt. The taste is fruity sweet like figs and prunes, with nice carbonation and not overly sweet. A slick mouthfeel accompanies a long, smooth finish. The ABV is completely hidden. A unique and tasty beer Id try again.

For the price, this beer is really something special. It pours almost like a soda would (which honestly surprised me - tons of CO2!). It is very carbonated but not in a way that deters from the sweetness and warmth of the beer. Flavor wise it is very fruity, like a Port meeting an ale, but it is done perfectly and never gets tiring or sickly sweet. The alcohol is barely noticeable taste wise but it can definitely get on top of you. Tread carefully! 

Overall very impressed with this beer. Bought on a whim and will be buying again.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 Another great Belgium style beer from Unibroue. It is for sure one of, if not the best brewery in Canada, and anyone who loves Belgium style beers would agree!

This is a good brew but certainly not in league with Fin Du Monde and not close to the masterpiece which is their Maudite. It has an airy, fruity aroma. It is a bit simplistic and not witty enough. It washes down like a wine but the aftertaste does not linger. It suffices but does not soar. Nor does its notes offend the palette. I like but am not crazy for this brew.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2013 Enorme cerveza, un poco por debajo de la fin du monde pero riquisima. Un aroma genial, un sabor delicioso, tengo qué repetir ya!!!!!.
Revision: después de unas cuantas ya no creo que este por debajo de la fin du monde...
Pleasant appearance.Sweet, cereal like aroma with a hint of doughy spice. Not a bad beer, but not the best either

12oz bottle code C081209500F(?smudge)L @ 50° into Belgian goblet; very deep brown to black body flashing cranberry highlights when illuminated supports a quickly fading 1" light khaki head; a flash of cherry leads into big fig and date, passion fruit and melon, chocolate, and light coffee, subdued slightly tart yeast influence, somewhat vinous, faint clove and light spice, some white fruit building as this warms; medium, highly carbonated body revealing a slightly drying fruity, chocolatey finish
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a dark brown color with a lot of head. Lots of malt and belgian yeast flavors.

Dark and stormy. Aroma is a yeasty tang. Mouthfeel is a strong fizzy carbonation. Taste is a lingering tang. Palate is dry stickiness. Overall, a decent strong ale, but not malty enough for me. Wish it was bigger flavoured.
Bottle from the six type variety mini case purchased at Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh.  Very nice and quite unique.  Loved every sip.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2013 341mL bottle. Pours a dark brown hazy colour, frothy cream colour small bubble head. Little lacing, small carbonation. Aromas of dark fruit - prunes and cherries, caramel malt molasses Lively dried fruit mouthfeel, really long and lingering. Hints of coriander and marjoram. Most enjoyable with fruit, nuts and cheese, an after dinner treat. Fabulous!
Draft at pizza plant. Brownish red pour with a creamy off white head. Smells like fruit, apples, dark fruit. Tastes caramel, spices, cinnamon, yeast, brown sugar. A little funk in the middle.

Smells dark and like wine almost, with fruity hints.  Pours dark reddish brown with a thin white head.  Tastes like POG!  Passion fruit, oranges and guava.  Very fruity, leaves a fizzy feeling long after you swallow.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 Pours a dark brown with a one finger, off-white head that thins to a ring. Aroma has notes of caramel and brown sugar. Taste is sweet with hints of sugar and alcohol on the finish. Medium body with a medium-high effervescent carbonation. Bubbly in the mouth. A strong taste and great beer!

Wine-like aroma. Smells a little citrusy also. Im afraid Im just rating this from the bottle but going from the smell, Im gonna bet that the color is a darker golden and slightly cloudy look. Smells like it anyway. Wow. tastes. tangier than I thought it would. Little bit of cough syrupy aftertaste. Though still tingling. Very bright but also kinda sour.

Deep dark reddish brown with a light khaki head. Aroma is earthy with sweet prunes and a little raisin. A faint hint of citrus rind as well. Taste is is very sweet and malty with dark fruit standing out. A hint of cinnamon gives a little bite to the otherwise creamy texture. If you are a sweet and creamy fan, you have to try this one. It is a little over the top for me in the sweetness.
Boo!!!!!!!! That was eww!
Bottle into glass...  Brownish pour. W off whitehead..   fruity aroma..   awesome fruit and malts alcohol..  killer for its style

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 Interesting aroma ... Interesting taste... Both of kind of smoked wood...wine is barrel flavor... Interesting in a good way ... Smooth and real easy drinker believe it or not ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle, corked and caged, from Wilburs.  Deep, dark reddish-brown with a nice, light tan head that dissipates to almost nothing and no lacing.  The aroma is fairly sweet with dark fruits, earthy yeast and light caramel malts.  Similar flavor with red wine, grassy herbs and toasty malts.  Medium body with a chewy feel, crisp carbonation and a dry finish.  A complex and tasty sipper, eh?

Poured from 341mL bottle. Dark, slightly reddish brown with beige head. Aromas of dark dried fruit, sweet malt and yeast. Full creamy texture of light raisins, plums, and prunes.  Slightly dry on the finish.
February 2011. Bottle. Dark fruit and spice aromas. Poured dark brown with a beige head. Tangy fruity flavors with sugars, spice, dark malt and yeast notes. Great beer.
Bottle->Trappist.  Deep brown with small white head.  Aroma and taste are yeast, dark fruit, malt.  Dark, deep Belgian.  Excellent.

Bottle sample at a tasting at DSGs place. Thanks kerenmk. Pours an hazy brown with a nice head, aroma of honey vanilla, cherries and cinnamon, flavor is sweet with dried fruits and dried apricots, medium to full bodied

12 oz. bottle poured into a tulip. Appearance is very dark brown, almost black, with a tan head that disappears very quickly. The aroma is very rich. It reminds me of cola with dark fruits and a subtle alcohol scent. The taste is similar to the scent, but it is a bit sweeter and fruitier. More carbonation than I expected. Overall, this is a good, interesting beer.
Sweet and sour nose. Taste was not the same as nose. Still some dried fruit and spices but not as strong as nose indicated. Palate finish was smooth. Good stuff
Very dark chocolate beer.gritty with a good bitter taste.full but not too heavy really an interesting flavor.

Bottle shared at a tasting at DSGs place. Headless murky dark brown - not pretty. alcoholic, walnut liquor, nutmeg - weird and unexpected aroma, Sweet taste - candy and spicy - tonka and marzipan. Full and heavy body, delicate carbonation, warm.

Ruddy brown pour with tan head. Big aroma of dried fruit, cherries, raisins and plums, with sweet malty character. Quite sweet on the tongue, with mild roasty notes, caramel, biscuity yeast and alcohol. Well balanced with miniature champagne-like bubbles; a little too fizzy for my taste, but still nice.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours dark brown with a off white head. Aroma of raisins, fruit, malts and some booze. Bittersweet, fruity, some malts, yeast and caramel too, nicely balanced; one of those that you just sip on and enjoy... Really liking this one right now.

At a tasting, thanks, small stable creamy head,a bit murky lightish brown colour, aroma of orange blossom, nuts and some stone fruits, flavour of dark bread, dark stone fruits, nuts and some caramel, heavy and quite alcoholic. Not too enjoyable.
Pours dark brown, aroma of fruit, nutty, malt. Delicious fruity, wine nutty flavours that I found to be fairly enjoyable..

This pours a medium brown color with a foamy, beige head. The aroma is slightly yeasty and malty with some dried fruit. The taste is very rich and bold with lots of complex flavors. There is mostly dried fruit and spices that finishes with a lingering yeast after taste. Gives off a good little alcohol warmth as well. Very well made!

Pours dark brown w/ tan head that dissipates fast, leaves a little lacing. There is a wonderful aroma of dried plums and alcohol. Has a nice carbonation that lends a crisp bite to the creamy texture. The flavor is a sweet fruity flavor of dried plumbs, roasted malt and spices with alcohol warmth. Excellent! Perfect for a special occasion, if you can wait. Better than Chimay Grand Reserve.

Deep plum-purple color. Head is one-finger thick but dissipated quick. Aroma is red grape, very similar to my favorite wine style, Port. Other scents include touch of yeast, sour apple, fresh bouquet of mixed wildflowers. Taste is similar to port, mild grape and plum flavors. Has a sweet yet bitter grape quality on palate, leaving the taste of port wine. This is a very fine and flavorful and enjoyable sipping beer. There isn't much lace left on the glass but there is cling to the glass similar to bourbon whiskey and wine from the liquid itself. Excellent beer. I'm also getting on the palate a cask flavor of wood and very mild smokiness combined with strawberries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Delicious Belgian style brew that's fruity with a lot of delicate floral notes. Very understated while still being flavorful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours a cloudy dark brown with a thin light tan head that retains well. Aromas of cherry and brown sugar. Very smooth taste, sweet yeast up front, dark fruit, and molasses. Alcohol is very well masked, almost no bitterness whatsoever. One of my favorites from unibroue.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Bel color bruno con riflessi rossastri e cappello di schiuma beige (almeno in apparenza, il locale era ben poco illuminato!). Aroma e gusto fruttati e maltosi, note di frutti di bosco (more e lamponi), caramello, lievito, zucchero di canna e un finale leggermente vanigliato. Corposa, vellutata, liquorosa... ottimamente bilanciata e dannatamente buona! Birra fantastica, con unetichetta stupenda per giunta.

750 mL bottle purchased from MB for $6.99. Corked (no shit). To snifter it pours a delightful chestnut purplish varnished brown with a trim, sudsy, off-white head half a fingernail in length. Strong aromas of prune juice, raisins, Trappist yeast, bubblegum, booze, oak, pear skins, green cardamom, and a fern-like botanical character, as well. For its flavors: starts off bittersweet with notes of candied sugar, pear skins and aged hops; from there its looking at yeast, booze, oak, and burnt rubber. Liquorice, leather, and plums by swallow. Alcohol instantly recognizable. I like this; not great by any means, but worth the money paid, and then some.

The aroma is primarily dark fruit with hints of Belgian yeast and malts. Pours a dark prune juice brown with a mostly diminishing off-white head and spotty lacing. The taste is a rich subtle sweetness. Dark dried fruit, sweet malt  grain, with a hint of citrus. Medium body with average carbonation. Overall, very enjoyable after a evening meal.

est bonne en crime, encore une fois unibrou nous en donne plein le pallet.tres bonne!

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Jadore la bouteille de même que le design de létiquette. Couleur brun foncé, liquide ténébreux. Belle mousse beige qui sexhausse. Nez de fruits confits, de rhum, dépices, avec une pointe de chocolat noir vanillé. La levure est également très présente, typique dUnibroue. En bouche, cest sucré : des notes de rhum brun, de sucre, de levure sont présentes et confèrent à cette bière une présence en bouche et une chaleur hors de lordinaire. Peu damertume, cest davantage les notes de rhum qui demeurent présentes du début à la fin. Excellent produit. Avec Unibroue, cest difficile de se tromper. Cheers!

Brune presque noire mais assez limpide, avec une mousse cassonade qui ne dure pas. Mi-épaisse. Reflets de cuivre. Des céréales grillées et du scotch, avec du boisé ; un peu de rose aussi. Au goût, Des sucres fruités insoupçonnés, avec une pétillance qui souligne le whisky et le malt. Très savoureuse. Alcool bien harnassé, et chaleur combinée à du sucre en fin de gorgée. Moins brutale et agressive que dautres fortes de type belge, la Trois Pistoles est une autre réussite dUnibroue sur tous les plans, tant visuel quolfactif ou gustatif.

A - Pours a dark murky brown.

S - Candied cherries, figs, raisins, alcohol.

T - Zesty dark fruit, spicy, peppery yeast, very crisp flavors going on. A simple syrup sweetness pushes towards the end but finishes on the dry side.

M - Strong carbonation. Prickly.

This beer has zip! Nice dark fruit flavors that are tart, rich and sweet without being heavy. I love the dry finish. A very easy drinking beer. Great job!

Serving type: bottle

08-25-2010

12 oz bottle poured a hazy dark brown with orange highlights.  Has a surprisingly fizzy head like a soda. 

Complex aroma of ripe and dark fruits, bread, toasted malt, port wine and spices. Interesting, but Im not sure what this will taste like. Alcohol becomes more evident with warning. 

Taste - the flavor components one would infer from my description of the aroma are all there, yet the flavor is a bit different than I expected. More and richer malt flavor for one thing. More subtle spiciness for another. Not quite as bold or enticing as the premier Belgian counterparts (e.g., Rochefort 8), but a fine balanced brew that avoids the over-spicing or imbalance that sometimes besets Belgian style ales. Enjoyable and lingering aftertaste with a striking dark fruit flavor. High ABV partially hidden.

M - medium body (perhaps a bit thin for style) and medium-high carbonation. Creamy smooth.

O - Exceptional aroma and flavor make this easy to recommend.

Strong ripe fruit aroma, is a dark brown in color with thick frothy head, taste is lightly fruity with a hint of roasted malts, also a nice easy bitter finish, gentle on the palate

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle enjoyed at home. Pours a deep cola brown with a quickly dissipating off white head. Aroma of dark cherries and toffee.   Loads of carbonation.  Flavors of cherries, toffee and toasted malt.  Crisp and clean finish.  Nice.

2012/12/30 - chocolate, dark fruit & boozy aroma. Smooth taste. Sweet,  boozy finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 Extremely drinkable for being 9 percent.  I gulp a big bottle of these down no problem.  Aroma is of sour fruits and red wine.  Taste is similar, with a strong caramel presence.  Drinking straight out of the bottle enhances the flavours.

Very good clean beer. Hard to believe it s 9%. Pours dark like a cola, nice thin white head. Very Sweet aroma of really ripe fruits. Bitter yet smooth to taste. Great Product!!! As far as im concerned best Unibrou product they have to offer!!

Pours a translucent dark brown with bubbly beige head that dissipates to leave moderate lacing. Aroma of belgian esters, dark fruits, and a hint of roasted malt. Taste follows, but a slight peppery finish. Good stuff, but the belgian is a bit off to me.

Aroma of raisins, dates and prunes.   Slight dry taste with some toasty notes and prune flavors.  Very carbonated. I'm gonna let it warm up a little. Not much better.  This Belgian flavor is not my favorite in this beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown pour. Aroma is plum, raisin, little bit of spice and caramel. Surprisingly light mouth feel for the strength of the beer. Flavour is dark fruits, yeast, spice. Very well done.

Pours a deep dark brown with a flourishing head of beige foam that recedes to a very thin cap. Soapy lacing and alcohol legs.  On the nose its cherries, bready yeast, strong malt undertones, sticky fruit and some horse blanket. The hops are forward on the palate with a little pepper accompanied by the yeasty sweetness and the ripe fruits. The malt is good and strong like a dark beer should be but the balance is perfection. It has a medium-heavy body but its practically weightless on the palate and finishes off-dry with some alcohol warming.  This ale has  dash and a soaring spirit.  One of the best.
Tap pour dark brown.  Nose of sweet, bubble gum and hint of spice.  Taste sweet. Malt, fruit and mild peppery spice
Tastes and smells fruity. Cant quite put a finger on the other aromas/flavors.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 Another really good Belgian ale from these guys. Nice apple and candy aroma. Flavors follow the nose but with a great caramel backing and bitter finish. Very nice.
Belgian ale,  dark chocolate pour,  nice head on the pour,  full body,  sweet finish, it bites initially,  but becomes smoother as the palate adjusts.  Wonderful beer!

341ml. Brune foncée avec mousse épaisse qui diminue lentement. Odeur fruitée typique Unibroue mais on sent aussi le caramel. Le gout. Wow! Riche gout de malt sucré à saveur caramel rôti avec une fin subtile d'agrumes, gout qui s'estompe graduellement une fois la gorgée terminée. Carbonation moyenne-faible. Un délice.
Wow wow wow! Served at cellar temp, just a great beer really fantastic. Carmel notes and a great finish a must try!

From notes - tulip pour of hazed dark burnt caramel liquid with full, fluffy white head.  Nose is quite fruity, citrus and caramel with smooth, sweet malt coming through heavy.  Flavor follows of course, with sharp, sweet, dark fruit, raisins, black currant, and followed with sweet caramel and toffee notes.  Medium body and quite rich.  Almost too sweet for me.

Nice brown/burgundy color with two finger head that diminished but left great lacing.  Dark fruit and berry aroma with some spice.  Same tastes as aroma, sweet with spice and a little alcohol warmth, but not too much.  Sticky body but dries nicely leaving a bit of sweet aftertaste.  Good Belgian style ale.  Not as good as actual Belgians like St. Bernardus or Westmalle but pretty darn close and very good for the price and availability.  Would definitely drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity and floral.  Sweet fruit taste.  Sweet to the point of being cloying.  Didn't enjoy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clean malty aromas.  Deep brown with a beige head.  Sweet malt aromas.  Full bodied with a sweet finish.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Bottle (341 ml). Murky and dark brown with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma of Unibroue yeast, spices, dark fruits, caramel and roasted malt. Taste is not moderately sweet with spices, dark fruits, caramel, malt and roasted malt. Medium body. Warming alcohol and spices. Fizzy carbonation. My favorite from Unibroue line-up. Good fresh, good with some age. Excellent winter beer.

EDITED: We have done a 2009-2013 vertical and, while the beer was really different from one year to another, I couldnt tell which was my favorite/least favorite. It became mellower, fruitier and less spicy with age, but it also loose a bit of body.
Second only to La Fin du Monde.  It doesnt need my praise or analysis, though i will say that i drink La Fin during the regular season but switch to this during the playoffs.

Pours a ruddy brown with hazy garnet highlights and a thin off white head that quickly dissipates to a ring on top. Brown sugar, light fruit and lots of yeasty esters make up the bulk of the aroma. The flavor is yeasty and bready with a lot of burnt and brown sugar. Light non descript fruity flavors and a touch of alcohol round out this out quite nicely. Medium body with a spirited level of carbonation and a sweet bubbly mouthfeel. I really liked this beer. I know its appropriate for the style, but the carbonation in this and most Belgians for me ruins the mouthfeel.

355ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany brew (Lovibond 36) with not much head or lace. Aroma is winey - sweet alcohol. Taste is... Fantastic.... Port wine (well, not as sweet as port) dominates. Dark fruits and spices with a real boozy undercurrent. I tasted black licorice and coca-cola. Which actually contributes nicely to this beer. Very unique. Very tasty. Very complex. Great palate.  Lots of carbonation which is surprising given the lack of head or lace. A favourite!
The aroma on this beer reminds me of some fine wines.  Great color and flavor that is smooth.  A bit of alcohol, but youll have that at 9%.  Great beer!!!
More Unibroue goodness at Antons Tap Room. On tap in proper stemware. Deep clear mahogany with little/quickly dissipating head. Roasty, malty, fruity, lil boozy goodness.

Dark brown pour. Complex nose but mostly toasted malt and yeast. Some dried fruit. Again, roasted malt flavor, a good tinge of sweetness on the finish. Full bodied with lingering flavors on the palate.
Its a belgian.  Belgian spices.  Has a little fruit.  Darker than most.  All the Unibroue beers taste the same to me.  Best thing about this one is the label.

Oh Unibroue Trois Pistoles, how I used to love thee! Smell is semi-sour with - ??? - some unidentified dark fruit and spices. Flavors are in line with an agressive  carbonation... blah! I remember it being a lot more complex with a really sweet and alcoholic finish, now it is just some Unibroue yeast-derived tasting black brew. Either my memory is failing me or I always end up drinking them Unibroue in the wrong spot at the wrong time...

Pours a deep brown color with a couple fingers of eggshell foam. The nose is full of roasted malts, dark fruit and a touch of burnt sugar and spice. On the palate this beer is amazingly balanced; sweet brown sugar, spice dark fruit, touches of earth, cocoa... nothing sticks out everything just melds beautifully with one another creating a smooth delicious brew !
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 This is my favorite beer so far. It has great aroma. Taste is well balanced. Its not overly bitter either. Everybody should try this beer!

Deep dark ruby in color with three fingers of bubbly off white foam. Leaves a thin tan cap on top. Looks very lively. Smell of dark cherries, raisins, rum and sourdough. Bold flavors of fruits and a sort of cocoa taste. Slight sweetness. Full bodied and bubbly, alcohol warms you quickly but the alcohol taste is well hidden. Dry finish. Dynamite beer from one of my favorite styles.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 pours dark brown with a thin white head that quickly dissipates.aroma is malty,yeasty,plums,raisins and spice.flavor is same as aroma.thin body with very apparent alcohol.has a slight hop finish. well balanced.and delicious.only knock is the thin body.
On tap. Pours very dark with a thick off-white head that does not last long but leaves behind nice lace. Strong fruity aroma mixed with yeast. Lots of fruit with a dry finish. Nice beer.
Bottle. Pours a very dark brown color with almost no head on it. Nose is intense, with some fruit and yeasty sweet tones in there. Taste is much the same, and characteristic of the Belgian style.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 Draft at Farmers Cabinet in Dec 2012 and later at Khyber Pass in April 2014. Dark clear ruby red pour that starts with a large foamy off-white head. Deep malty red fruit. Plums and Prunes. Aged bing cherries.  Port wine. 2012 draft seemed funkier; more and with pickles. 2014 draft feels maltier; much less funk, more chocolate cake. Molasses and blackberries. Generally sweet but a mostly dry finish. Nice and juicy despite the rich aged red fruit flavors. Complex cherry cordials. 2014 version easily beats the 2012 vintage. Bumped my rating up from 3.9 to 4.2.

Nice head upon pouring 
Great dark ale. Clean finish 
High alcohol, too much as I wish I could drink more!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle and Draught.  When I lived in ME this was my go to after Allagash if I was in a Belgian mood.  Great beer at a great price point.

Bottle at home.  
Appearance:  Off-white head dissipates immediately.  Lots of fizzing afterwards.  Perhaps I pour bad?  No lacing.  Dark brown / cola color.
Aroma:  Dark fruit, vinous, ester.  Reminiscent of a dubbel/quad meets port. Some complexity.
Taste:  Port. Dark fruits. Quite sweet, some clove. A hint of tang.
Palate:  Medium/full body. Dry finish. Lively carbonation.  Mouth-coating, a little slick.
Overall:  This is my third time with this, but first review.  I remember it being ... well, just "more" the last time.  Lush, full-bodied, a delight to sip through the night with friends.  Im splitting the difference in the overall rating from those last times:  (14+18)/2 = 16.

Great aroma of sugar, anise, yeast. Dark reddish, cloudy brown color.
Delicious cherry, anise, malty flavor. Quite a delicious Unibroue offering. My second favorite after Terrible.
dark brown color, aroma of grain, caramel, spices, dark fruit, same flavors, slightly boozy, very enjoyable

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 The color is an opaque dark reddish brown with a large off-white head, and the aroma blends Belgian yeast, sour fruit, and caramel malts. The taste is slightly sour, mildly sweet, and a touch umami, and the palate fuses a lively carbonation, thin and slick texture, medium body, and a medium-length finish.

Bière brune de 9 % dalcool. Léger col mousseux, elle possède un odorat sucré, à la limite fruité. Elle possède un aspect céréalier en bouche et un goût de fumé. Elle possède comme un goût de jambon à lérable en bouche avec une finale assez forte.

Good, but for a strong Belgian, it comes across almost as a barley wine without the ABV. Much more flavor comes through after resting for a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great beer. Finishes like a fine wine.  Flavors are very distinct of fruit and caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Strong fruity aroma (green apple, grape/plum), with a little caramel. Caramel, sweet lightly bready malt flavor. Raisin, cherry, apple fruit flavor, with some nice mild spiciness. No alcohol flavor; but definite warming. Lower carbonation than Id expect for the style.
Yeast and fruit aroma.  Pours a very dark caramelly brown with a thick light brown head.  Well balanced.  Malty with some fruit undertones.  Nice.

Big yeast aroma with soft biscuit/oat undertones. Deep ruby/magenta in color with a massive tan foam. Strongly carbonated flavors of wheat, grains, barley, and some soft mango or grapefruit undertones. Overall, this is a moderately complex ale with a nice boozy finish. Id give it an A- rating.
belle couleur foncé elle a une plusieurs saveurs se pointe le bout du nez comme un vieux porto surtout un fin de bouche elle est delicieueuse bonne biere qui rechauffe le palais

Pours a deep, redwood brown with a crackling, small head.  The aroma is peaches, caramel, coffee, and a little boozy warmth.  The flavor presents all of those tones, and more hop bite than I expected.  Theres a sweet and tart finish that I associate with red wine.  I enjoyed this.

Pours a mahogany brown with a big bubbly tan head.  Aroma has belgian spices, orange, lemon, banana, and yeast.  The taste retains many of the Belgian impressions.  It is big on spice.  Of the different fruits first detected, I get the banana flavor being most prominent with some apple as well.  Very dry and heavy with fizzy, bubbly carbonation.  Medium body.  Fruity aftertaste.  The alcohol content here hides itself rather well.  This is another very good effort by Unibroue.

After all these years, I cant believe Ive never rated this one. I picked up a bottle from Juilos the other day. Poured into a snifter. A jet black brew with light frothy tan head that quickly goes to a thin lace. Carbonation is light and fizzy. Sweet-lum aromas and flavors. Good yeast profile. Slightly earthy. More raisiny sweetness on the back side. Decent enough, but not stellar.

Deep dark amber brown, creamy lasting tan head. Rich port-ish aroma. Dark burnt roasted malts, spices and dark fruits. Softly carbed, medium-full bodied, moderately hopped. Tart port like finish. Trappiste eh Canuck? DNFL (Definately Not For Lagerboys)

341 ml bottle, thanks Loic!!  Pours a dark chestnut brown with an off-white head.  Aroma is spicy and floral, true to the belgian style.  Taste is reflective of aroma but some alcohol does come through reflecting the robust 9.0% ABV.  Soft carbonation and a medium body.  Not my favourite, largely due to the presence of the 9.0% ABV and my aversion to beers with a prominent spicy/floral taste.

Dark Brown with a fizzy head. Smell and flavor are comprised of Plums, Cloves, Spices, Figs, Yeasts and Roasted Malts. Palate is surprisingly light and thin, considering the style. Definitely a different (more fruitier) type of Strong Ale, but worth checking out nonetheless

An old favourite that I have finally found again for a tasting.  Into a Tulip you go, you beauty.  I gave the bottle a swirl before pouring; I like the flavours the sediment adds.  Pours a a murky burnt amber, nice and dark, with a lively tan head that is slow to dissipate.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, grapefruit background, coriander.  Flavour is... just as good as I remember.  Rich dried fruits, orange peel, spice, sweetness, all backed by that delicious yeasty flavour.  Effervescent on the tongue that mingles well with the rich mouthfeel.  Oh man this is such good beer...

The beer is a dark hazelnut hue, with a half inch of beige head that leaves a decent amount of lacing on the glass. The aroma brings malt, yeast, caramels, dark fruit. The flavor is fairly sweet, with dark fruits and yeast. Alcohol warmth emerge in the finish. Lingering notes of sweet, dark fruits soaked in alcohol. Medium bodied with moderately high carbonation. While not as delectable as the upper tier beers of this genre, Trois Pistoles is ubiquitous and enjoyable.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-23-2011
Nice dark ale.  A little too bitter for my taste.  Still a sense of sweet behind the bitterness that permeates and helps balance the taste.
This is simply my favorite beer. I love the way it looks, smells, but the way it tastes is even better. Unfortunately, since moving to Philly it is harder to find, but when I do Im in heaven

nice rich dark ale with sweet fruity overtones that float through the subtly smooth spices, Beautiful

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 750 into tulip. Very dark brown with creamy head. Aroma of dark fruits cherry plum. Oakiness and vanilla too. Taste is nice and mellow more of the oak vanilla and dark fruit really hides the 9% well. Mouthfeel is great drank it with some hearty irish beef stew and the beer cut through everything, really nice compliment. Quiet an amazing brew.

Aroma: Field berries, cherry, raisins, plum and a bit of vanilla. A very complex nose well supported by alcohol. we can also find some spices such as cinnamon and a bit of caramel. Superb nose.
Appearance: Pale brown rocky average head that disappear kind of fast. A bit of lacing. Color is dark brown.
Taste: fruit accents are back. Alcohol is very present (may be too much)
Very warmth mouth feel wrapping field berries, caramel and molasses notes enhancing the complexity of this beer. No doubt  that Unibroue knows how to make superior beer and this one is a good example. A bit less alcohol would be even better. (May be at 7% or 8%)

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Une couleur ambrée très foncé, presque violet. Nez des baies et fruits. Le goût initiale est rendu un peu sourdine par les bulles vives, mais ils se convertissent à une effervescence doux suivie par le goût des fruits et mélasse. Les saveurs reste bien sur la langue pour quelques minutes. Même avec 9% dalcool il ny as pas un goût dalcool mais la chaleur qui accompagne les bières forte reste.

Unibroue Trois Pistoles has a thin, beige, cola-style fizzy head and a dark, murky, bubbly, dark-brown appearance with lots of beige chunks floating about. The aroma is of fruit-cake fruit, dark bread, fudge, and spice. Flavor is of the same, with low bitterness. Mouthfeel is light and watery (surprisingly), and Unibroue Trois Pistoles finishes dry and ice tea-like. This is a strange ale, and I was a bit underwhelmed by it. Its worth checking out, though. RJT

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 (08/10/2012) Bomber sampled @ RBBSG 2012 - Left -over edition. Thx. to Vincent I believe. Pours dark caramel amber, clear. Sweet white bread taste, spices, toffee, caramel, dash caramel, light herbs, dark malts, prune, quite high carb. Fine, interesting, good / solid take on the style - like it. ////////// (22/03/2015) 4.5 year old bottle sampled. No notes, no new score but really impressive, more like 4.7/5 than 4/5. Huge amounts of rich dark fruits flavors, highly impressive.

Noire aux reflets roux, col mince et persistant. Nez de cerises, de prunes et dalcool. Consistante en bouche, faible carbonation, sucrée, peu amère, longue en bouche sur des arômes de mélasse et de fruits macérés... dans le rhum!

Elle cache tout de même bien son 9%. Très agréable.

Smells of apricot and blueberry, medium brown little head. Bubbly mouthfeel with a little of the fruits and some funk. Try again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Belgian strong ales are not really my thing.  goes down warm which was nice.

Dark red, with thick head. Lots of cherries with notes of chocolate. Very creamy mouthfeel with mild taste for the abv. Really great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity/yeasty nose with a hint of sweetness. Dark cloudy black cherry color. Lots of little bubbles from bottle conditioning. Fruity original taste with a smooth spicey finish. Very well crafted, with a finish that leaves your tongue ready for more sparkle and a little alcohol warmth.

Bottle pour at Rocket City Brewfest. Dark amber with a creamy head; rich earthy aroma with malt, coffee and spice fragrances. Very rich flavor - meant to be sipped. Rich roasted malt, some coffee and chocolate, spices and and nice hop bitterness underneath.

A perfect dessert beer; paired this with red velvet cake my daughter baked - MONEY!  Notes of sweet cherries abound.  The dark malty tones soften the high alcoholic content.  Great, mountainous head. Gorgeous reddish, brick color.  Dynamite!

Fantastic looking and smelling beer. Aroma is complex, deep dried fruit, like cherries, with clove and spice. Colour is a crazy deep purply-black, with a rocky tan head that lasts all day.  Taste is complex range of bitter and sour, with more of that dried fruit. The mouthfeel is super-full, with warming alcohol lingering throughout the experience. I cant believe Ive never bothered to rate this, but here it is. Great beer!
Pours an almost black with nice head which stays. Aroma is dark fruit, some alcohol. Taste is similar with lots going on. Overall great beer.

NIce pour, perfect head opaque dark anber.  Wonderful scents here, plum cinnamon clove.  Mouthfeel is perfect for easy drinking, thinner than expected.   Tastes of slight plum and spice with a nice warming toasty roasted finish. Carbonation is just right, not too many bubbles.  Very nice, Thanks Dave R.!
caramel, roasty, floral, apple, black, cloudy, frothy, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, thin feel
bottle. brown with medium head. big spicyness. malty with sweet fruit, raisin and plum. slight alcohol, pretty well hidden.

Bottle from Kensington Wine Market, Calgary. It pours dark brown, with a thick beige head. Rather impressive head retention! The nose is spice, earth, leather, caramel and dark fruit. The taste is wood, caramel, raisin, date, leather, earth, vinous aspect, bitter chocolate and spice, with a dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate-high carbonation. Flavoursome and well balanced. My only gripe (as with the other Unibroue beers) is the rather high and rough carbonation. Still a rather good beer all-round.

WTF is with the high ratings here? This pours nice from a bottle: black coffee brown with beige head. But thats the best of it. Sickly sweet aroma of sugar and tin foil. Putting fucking spices in beer should be a capital offense!!!! Sickly sweet, bready potpourri tastes like a mad mans version of soda pop for Halloween! If I never have this slop again it will be too soon. Did I mention that I dont care for it?
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Lots of yeast character, fruity/banana, plum/prune notes, bready. One of my favorite beers.

12 oz bottle served in a Duvel tulip. Pours a ruby brown with an inch of beige/off white head and decent lacing. Aroma is raisins, brown sugar, candied plums, and a definite Belgian yeast strain. There is also a red wine like quality to the smell. Taste is sweet up front. Molasses, apples, grapes, plums, raisins, blood orange, and candi sugar. It gives way to a subtle caramel bready maltiness that blends perfectly with the rest of the beer. There may be faint chocolate in the back as well. Medium to thin mouthfeel and well hidden alcohol. This beer is a great dessert sipper.

Aroma is pleasant, hints of dark fruits, over-ripe cherries, plums. Sweet burnt sugar and that classic Unibroue spicy Belgian yeast. This tastes not as sweet as the aroma implies, But not complaining. Apples, grainy malts upfront. Then the spicy yeast and the dark cherries and plums finish the flavor. This is proof that Unibroue was designed to brew Belgian style ales. For this is a perfect example of a well crafted BSDA boarderline Quad.  Highly Recomended

Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of candy, sweets (zuurtjes), artificial dark fruits, light sour notes and yeast. quite sweet flavour, honey and malts. Malty finish with chocolate and honey.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Wilrijk. Courtesy of BelgBeerGeek. Thanks Vincent!)

750ml bottle, beautiful dark slightly reddish brown with small head. Aroma is  fruit and yeast but lighter than I expected. Taste is sort of dark overripe fruit, with maybe more plum than anything else and really sticks around for a while. Lots of carbonation. Im not blown away but its quite good.
This may be Unibroues best beer.  Dark and rich, with a full fruit and molasses flavor that mask the high alcohol.  I am very willing to return to this beer whenever it is available.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2013 This beer is awesome. I enjoy how it is highly carbonated for a Belgian. Wonderful flavor, slightly sweet, yet dry. Belgian yeast is nice. Dark fruits come through towards the end. This beer wonât let you down.
I wasnt able to get much aroma. Rich chocolate brown color. Its flavor was sweet then bitter with an oily finish. I thought this was great with my Rib-eye!
Limited aroma, but hints of the sweetness from a hefeweizen. Taste is also sweet in the same way, with the minor robust malt addition. Very drinkable and filling, but not too many bells or whistles.

Poured from the bottle that comes in a four pack. Dark brown in color, tan head, spicy smell, sweet taste, strong enough to pair with a spicy meal. Delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark fruit initial taste, lingering after taste that is pleasant. Not as yeasty as some in bottle fermented beers. 

I think the Maudite is a little better, but this is still quite a fine Belgium Ale. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours mahogany with a thin tan head w/ little to no lacing. The aroma is an abundance of spicy notes.  The taste is an absolute flavor explosion!  Its very spicy & quite unique. The body is fairly light which makes it dangerously drinkable. An amazing beer!

Again, I cant believe that I havent rated this beer yet. Ive had it probably half a dozen times. Rich in aroma. Dark fruit and dark chocolate. Nice alcohol balance. You really cant tell that its there. Smooth and delicious.

Bottle sample @ 2nd RBBSG, August 11th 2012. Courtesy of BelgBeerGeek.
Souvent dégustée, jamais notée.
Ambrée/brunâtre, col fin beige.
Arôme de fruits noirs, malté, sucre brun.
Palais fruité noir, levure laissant ce profile bien belge, note de prune avec un beau pétillant. Solide pour le style, le tout conserve une brève douceur sucrée brun avec un fini de fruits rouges allant presque sur des notes de vin.
Poured from a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass.  Aroma has a mixture of dark roasted malts with many fruits.  Taste intially comes across as a caramel note but quickly changes to citrus then apples.
Sampled at RBBSG. A bit hazy dark red color, small off-white head. Smell is malts, yeast and light to medium sweetness. Taste malts and medium sweetness. Way too high carbo, medium body.
Bottle.  Sweet and strong.  Nice malt flavor and sweetness with the typical Belgian yeastiness.  Strong yet easy drinking.
This beer pours in an almost rusty brown color. It has good flavor that leaves a sweet, almost syrupy taste on your palate. High alcohol content that leaves you feeling very relaxed.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Froot loops notes and classic Unibroue yeast aroma. Dark effervecance and a nice cloudy foam top. Can?t get over that Froot loops aroma !? What?s behind that artificial fruit nose ? Soft in mouth presence, touch of herbes de provence. I?m going crazy, froot loops style cassoulet ? No hop needed, no hop showing. Distant alcool, so much fun to drink an easy beer like that. Easy yet complexe. Easy, in a possitive way. Easy like enjoying life with all its Grands Crus. Its not perfect, but the fact that I got this bottle at a gas station for 6$ makes it pretty close the perfection.

A bit forbidding at first. Extraordinarily black with a comparatively light head looks just exquisite in my tulip glass. The aroma is very rich prunes and vanilla. Flavour is raisins, alcohol, toffee. I described it to my friend as a blue cheese of beers. It doesnt taste anything like that on the surface, but underneath thats the way I feel about it. World class. Theres nothing like a high quality Belgian Strong.
Bottle poured a cloudy reddish brown color, aromas of dark fruits, herbas, malt, and some light spice.  Flavor is the same, with some light citrus and some spice.  Nice beer overall.
Pours thick and looks creamy, thick head that lasts a decent amount of time. has a hint of sweetness ans a fruity flavor. looks thick but goes down quick and does linger on palate.

A good beer. Tastes a little like Trader Joes ale. Pours a dark brown, black with a light head. Light sweet smell. Taste is great, thick and powerful. Nice creamy aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells fruity like a light beer, has a nice mix of malty stout flavor with a sweet floral taste. Not as much aftertaste as you'd expect. Decent.

Spicy -sweet aroma, dark thick color, and well ratained 1/2" beige head. outhfeel is lighter than I thought it would be , but filled up towards the end, as was rich and creamy. Flavor of mollases, raisens, dark cheery, dark chocolate, and cognac. Excellent as usual for this brery. Hop heads will be disspaointed, this is rich malt and some yeast .

Pours an opaque black with dark red tinge. Two finger head with that lingers with heavy lacing. Primarily lightly sweet, but rich flavor.  Aromas strongly of dark fruit, dried cherries, raisin, hint of bubble gum with some hints of oak. Mild resinous hop hint. Malt  Full bodied with moderate, soft carbonation. Slightly astringent & moderate finish that is mostly sweet. Very heavy beer, but great flavor
Caramel, toffee, fruit, and spice in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and bready with caramel and spice.  Spice, citrus, and a little alcohol in a very tasty, yet dry, finish.  Really good.

Bouteille 341ml. Couleur brune foncée, mousse beige dense et abondante. Arôme dépices (poivre?), de levure, de cannelle et dalcool. Goût dépices, de sucre brun, de porto et dalcool. Texture ample avec une bonne carbonation.

75 cl bottle @ hotel room, Seattle. BBE 26.01.2015.
Aroma is slightly sour and somewhat sweet with malt and plums. Flavour has lots of orange peel. Some warming alcohol and peppery spices also. Reminds me of Bernardus Christmas beer, which is more spicy though.
